text: I've been coming to ohjahs for about 2 years and tonight has by far been my worst experience. I usually get the hibachi fillet mignion which is around $10. They refused to accommodate because I wanted to order that and was sitting in the restaurant area. (Perfect amount of food.) I don't really care where it's cooked. So I asked if I could get the kids mean which is TINY, $14 dollars and doesn't even come with noodles. So I had to order noodles on the side which was another $3. I don't mind paying for what I want because I know they're a bit expensive, But they didn't want to change anything! The service ungodly awful. Refills took 10 minutes, horribly rude... I won't be back. I don't even want to give one star... TAKE YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE!

I have been here twice already, and it was okay.  Not sure if I would drive to that side of town again to go there.  We saw this place when we would eat at Cafe Rio which was across the street.  

The servers were nice.  The menu had a lot of selections.  They also served Chinese and Thai food.  Both times I have been there it was for sushi and not the hibachi, so I can't speak for that.  Thinking back, I can't even remember the name of the roll I tried and remembered if it was good.  Which goes to show it was probably just alright.  The restaurant is nice; and it is dark inside.

The funny thing, I do remember is that every time they brought out a dessert for a guest's birthday, the old school 'happy birthday' song (kids singing) would go on their sound system, haha
The service was good... the food was fresh and tasty. I had sushi not teppanyaki so I can't review on that. Nothing memorable but it's pretty close to my house so I will be going again.

We had a wonderful anniversary dinner at Ohjah Steakhouse. The food was very good and the service was top notch. This place is just as good or better than the other expensive Japanese Steakhouse restaurants but Ohjah is a much better value. We will be coming back here for sure. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice restaurant.

The menu has many tempting choices for you to choose from. We had the Hibachi dinner with New York steak, lobster tail, shrimp, and chicken. They were all perfectly cooked and delicious.  Next time i plan to try the sushi too. 


Also, we met some very nice people at our table which made the experience even better.

Ohjah is always a great time. If you want to go on a date and liven it up a little then ohjah is the spot. I have the scallops, filet, and chicken. Everything was super tender and juicy. 

I would recommend this spot for a local over a tourist though. It has a great atmosphere and can be a really good time. Chefs keep te table in a good mood!

The service was the worst we have had iin years. My wife and I ate there tonite. We live near by and have been waiting for it to open.  We were seated right away. The waitress got our drinks took our order for an appetizer that came in 10 minutes. We then ordered a 3 roll  sushi special. That took 25 minutes to come. Way to long. We never were asked if we needed a refill on are drinks even when mine was empty. Then it took 20 minutes just to get the waitresses attention to get the check. After she brings the check she says do want a refill. ( ya right after I'm done eating) I said no that might take another 20 min. It took us an 1 hour and 20 minutes to get out of there on a single order. We will never go there again. Oh, and the people at the next table complained the the manager to. He gave them a free desert wow. Food was good but not worth the bad service and long wait time. We were there at 6pm

Today is the first time I've been Ohjah and I'll visit here second time.
Ohjah is a Japanese restaurant with Hibachi. I go to the one located in the crossing of Decatur Blvd and Blue Diamond Rd. It is hard to find a proper parking lot in dinner time. The restaurant is separated as two parts. One is sushi bar and tables, the other one is Hibachi. Hibachi is so popular that we have to wait for 1 hour to came in. There are 3 big tables that can sit around 60 people. Light is comfortable, Aroma smell good, no music here. The noise is very loud because two many people sitting together and some parties also make noise. Server busser and cooks wear nice uniform. Service is good but I see sometimes elderly has difficulty talking with server, a young Asian lady.  I observed that she tries her best serve all customers but there are too many people eating here and she is the only server in hibachi room. Sometimes the refill beverage is not in time. I think two servers may be better at the dinner time.
Food is excellent and affordable. The combination of Ohjah with 7 course is only 32 dollars. The cooking in front of you is also a show that you can enjoy it. Cooks will clean the iron plate very well after finishing cooking. Overall the experience with Hibachi make me feel very good and I definitely will come back.
They have the best beef yakisoba here! I would definitely come back and try their Hibachi dinner.

I come to Ohjah pretty frequently and leave completely satisfied each time. Each visit we are greeted with a smile by the friendly staff. Whether it's hibachi or just regular dining, the food never disappoints. I typically enjoy ordering the 3 roll special or the Ohjah boat. They also have an amazing selection of sake, some of which are not on the menu. Service and management are top notch! All the servers I've had are so kind and attentive. It's always packed at this location, so make reservations!

Service is great! Sushi is always fresh. Has good food for the kids. Absolutely the best place I've been to for sushi (and I've tried many). Will continue to go here as my favorite sushi restaurant. (And the hibachi grill is pretty cool). 
Oh and they have a boat! Literally you can order a boat with sushi!

Amazing, delicious, tasty, love love it. Service is fast - as in 'breakneck speed fast'...a bit difficult to relax but if you're eating before a movie you'll for sure make it on time! This is a small place. I'd love to just order a large verson of the dinner salad, it's DELICIOUS. Next trip we'll go w/friends and order that huge gondola of sushi. Have been there twice so far, no complaints. Haven't tried the hibachi rooms yet.

I live within a minute from this place. And I couldn't be happier to have a Japanese Restaurant near me. But I wish they had bento box options (like most Japanese Restaurants do), which they could revenue from those who don't eat seafood, or for the children..

My wife and I joined friends at Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse (Blue Diamond and Decatur) recently. I was a little hesitant about the restaurant choice because I've never had a taste for sushi, but the majority rules, so I agreed. It was the night before New Year's Eve, and the restaurant was pretty much filled. Chefs were putting on shows at many tables. Patrons were clearly enjoying themselves; the restaurant was buzzing with laughter and excited chatter. Our service started off a little slow, but soon we had our appetizers. Everyone in our group had sushi; mine, thankfully, was cooked. And it was very good! Between the delicious appetizers and the salad, I was enjoying myself in spite of my earlier reservations about going to a restaurant known for its sushi. I could have left at the point and been very satisfied. 

But then the chef - I believe his name is Van - came over to our end of the table and started an amazing display of acrobatic and culinary showmanship that was a joy to watch. He introduced each element to us and was soon flipping things into the air and even flipped a cup into his hat all the while keeping a fast beat with his cooking tools. Fascinating to watch! The scallops and shrimp were excellent, and the vegetables were cooked and seasoned to perfection. But the standout was the steak. The most tender and flavorful steak I've had in years. Melt-in-your-mouth with no fat or waste at all. And we had more than enough to take home for leftovers. 

We left late, and as the chef and then the waiter cleaned the table, we asked what they were cleaning with. Lemon juice, they said - no chemicals. That impressed us. And he said they would clean it again the next morning. Overall, we were very impressed. Delicious food, very clean restaurant (even the restrooms were immaculate), friendly service and a terrific show, too. The Ohjah at Blue Diamond and Decatur is definitely worth revisiting.

One of the better sushi joints in the area. I've been here a few times and try to come by whenever I'm in Vegas. The fishes are fresh, so right on !! They've got a great selection of appetizers and sushi on the menu. If you don't like raw fish they serve a large variety of cooked food as well such as chicken terriyaki or noodles. This place never seems to disappoint. I'm always a satisfied customer !!!! Plus, I love the service and the attentive servers. 

Note - I usually order the sashimi salad, its spicy here though. I love that b/c it gives the salad an extra kick. Most sashimi salad I've tried aren't spicy at all, so this place makes it extra special. Different !! The baked green mussel are delish and a must order !! Needless to say, the sushi of course is off the hook !!

We come here quite a bit, I would say once or twice a month. We used to frequent more often than now, so we hadn't been in some time, but I have been to this location well over fifteen times.

Let me start off by saying the food here is definitely good. I cannot comment on the sushi, as I have never had it but the hibachi is always solid. Tonight we went and things seemed weird. 

It seems like Ohjah is getting cheap with their product. First, the chef told me he wasn't allowed to use extra garlic on my shrimp (or really use any garlic at all) because it is not procedure and he would get in trouble. Apparently management/ownership was getting annoyed with people asking for extra items and not paying. I would gladly pay for extra rice, veggie, etc. But garlic?! How expensive can a tablespoon of garlic really be. I would have paid for it had he said "garlic is extra" but he didn't; he just made it clear he wasn't allowed to use any garlic on ANY meat item other than steak..... Okay. 

Second, I have never counted the shrimp I get on my plate, but I would say they used to give you 8-10 shrimp per order. Today I got 5. Once again, okay. 

This was not the chefs fault by any means. I just feel as though ohjah is getting a little skimpy on their food. Hibachi is not cheap, so I will likely take my business elsewhere next time where they will gladly add garlic to my food.
I like the atmosphere and their prices!! specially the 3 rolls specials for only $25. It kids friendly and very wellcoming people.

My 3.5 year old daughter loves to eat here.  We have only done the cooking tables and each time we go she has a better time then before.  At first the tricks scared her - but now she totally gets into it.  Typically she doesn't each much, but here she eats everything we put in front of her.  One day maybe we will get to the other menu items - but it is too much fun to watch her interact with the cooking table chefs and even more fun to watch her clean her plate.

The ambiance is beautiful! The server, Doson, was absolutely polite, efficient, attentive and friendly! Thechef was funny and cooked our dinner in record time. Our 8 year old son was very entertained and enjoyed his filet meal!!

Would suggest filet with shrimp from the tempanyaki grill. Love this place!!

I went here with my family (party of 11) for my birthday dinner and I am really glad that we opted to go here. Everything about this place was perfect, from the ambience and service to the food itself. Definitely try the Hibachi combo if you're going here, it's a really good value for the quality and quantity of food that you receive. On top of that, the hibachi chef was incredibly talented and passionate about what he was doing. We arrived late for our reservation (sorry :( ) but the waiter was very understanding about it and didn't even rush us even with another reservation for our table only an hour from the time we arrived. Overall, it was a great experience and I will be back next time I visit Vegas! 100% recommended.
I'll tell you I was nervous to have sushi in Vegas but it was as good as any I've had in Seattle. Clean, friendly and yummy! Get the boat! Its beautiful and deliciously fresh! Worth every penny!

Amazing for what you get for the money,been back 3 times since first trying it.Great staff and great food.

Nice strong drinks too!
Best locals hibachi place Ive been to in vegas. Great prices service and food.
You won't be disappointed here...good food and great service.  Friendly atmosphere with fair prices. We'll be back and will recommend them to others...thanks!
Their teppanyaki is awesome and the service is good. Our chef was also very entertaining.

Very friendly service and management. Hibachi is ok, but sushi was great. Prices are very reasonable. $9 for the hibachi add-ons and from there you choose the meat (filet was an additional 8.5 so it would be 17.5 for filet).

We went for the first time for their lunch special. I go the the stores next door often and always smell something good coming from this place. 

There were only a few people in the restaurant as it had just opened. We were seated right away and our server was very friendly and polite. 

We got the lunch special that was actually a really good deal! This place doesn't do AYCE and most of the places we go to do. The special included 3 pieces of sashimi (chef's choice) 3 piece nigiri, and a roll for around $15. The quality of the sushi was excellent. Everything tasted fresh. I can't remember the name of the roll I got, but it had a mango salsa on top. It paired really well!

I want to come back to this place for more sushi and to try the hibachi! Definitely recommend it!

Ok so I've been to some prrrreeeeeetttttyy good Hibachi grills but this one was by far the best. This place was amazing and the food and service was great. My favorite thing here is the hibachi and sushi. The interaction with the chefs were amazing as well. I loved this place and I'm glad we went for my birthday. It was a blast.

We pretty much have tried most stuff here and everything is just oh so yummy! Our favorite Japanese restaurant in Vegas! Service is fast and the servers are friendly. Their sashimi platters are to die for, always fresh and big slices too!

I don't usually give 5 star ratings but in this case, I have no problem doing so. the staff are friendly and very attentive to the customer. the hibachi chef (tom) was a riot and a real entertainer. He made the whole experience one to remember so ask for him when you go. the food is top notch and I recommend the filet and shrimp. the food was fresh. the filet Mignon literally melts in your mouth. the appetizers of shrimp/calamari/vegetable tempura was fantastic and not too heavy. I have been there twice now and plan to make it one of my regular spots to eat. Both my dinners were just wonderful and the staff are top notch and have a way of making you feel at home. just a wonderful place to dine. Oh, I almost forgot, the prices are extremely reasonable for what you get. I cant think of one thing I would change about Ohjah except that I wish one were in Henderson so I wouldn't have to drive as far to get to it. But hey, one cant have it all. Its well worth the travel though. A must dine experience that one will not forget.

My wife and I absolutely love this place!  The hibachi is one of the best in Vegas and the prices are so affordable for the quality of food you receive. From the delicious soup and unique but delicious salad to incredible cuts of meat this place  rocks! Good luck finding a better filet mignon for anywhere near the price. The sushi has got to be my favorite that I've had. It is quite a bit more expensive than some of the more mainstream sushi spots, but too compare them to places like sushi mon would be an insult. They use super fresh cuts of fish and not even the seaweed has that nasty typical sushi flavor. It's really a demonstration on how sushi SHOULD be done. Another thing to keep in mind is the fact you are getting more than food at this hibachi and the show is always amazing no matter which chef you get. Some are funnier than others, but I enjoy getting a different routine every now and then. If you choose to eat the hibachi I strongly encourage to buy a round of sake bombs! It's a blast for you and your friends and surprisingly smooth. I eat here whenever I have an opportunity and it comes highly recommended. I'm currently trying to convince myself to spend the money and get the Kobe beef! Looks delicious!

Fresh sashimi clean presentations. 

Came here with a $20 certificate so we decided to go big and order the boat. This was a pretty good deal as it included 3 specialty rolls, salmon, ahi tuna, and hamachi sashimi, seaweed salad, and three types tobico for only $45. Just the specialty rolls were $10 - $12 each so it was well worth it. We also ordered the lychee Saki, they had a few different kinds of flavored Saki which are good for those don't like the original flavor of Saki. We were told the boat would take about 15 min but they served us each an order of the house salad as we wait. 

When the boat came out I was very impressed by the presentation. The specialty rolls were OK, but what put the boat over the top was the slices of sashimi. Each slice was about half and inch thick with about 3-4 slices each. The quality of the fish was superb and with each bite you certainly can taste the freshness. In my mind what differentiates a lot of these sushi restaurants is the quality and freshness of their fish. Ohjah certainly displays fresh quality ingredients. 

I would love to come back and try their Hibachi. But would definitely come back for their sashimi.

Better than the Osaka, Hamada, or Benihana at much more affordable price.  Nothing fancy, but a neighborhood Hibachi/Sushi restaurant shouldn't be overly fancy or overly priced.  The sushi is good, and the 23.95 for any 3 specialty sushi items make it even tastier. 

Definitely worth a trip if you are considering eating Hibachi anywhere in Las Vegas.

Went a few weeks ago and the service was nice. Went in for tepanyaki, but the food was a salty overload. Although we enjoyed the atmosphere, it was a different change from our usual Musashi dinners. Service 3 stars. Food 2.

I love this place! The owner always remembers us and welcomes us with a smile, even though we have a 2 year old who came sometimes be rambunctious. I have only come for sushi, but want to try the teppan yaki one day. Try the "you and me" "pink lady" rolls. So yummy! Make sure you get the buy two, get one free discount.

I really enjoyed the food here. We ate hibachi. My lobster tail was amazing! The scallops were really good too. I'm craving it now haha! Was a very good first experience. I always see this place driving blue diamond. Glad that I gave it a try. Will have to do sushi next time!
Goodbye dinner for Hiroki had to include sushi! Awesome night. Awesome friends. Awesome food. Sorry we couldn't get oysters. Next time, and there will definitely be one!
We come here every week and never disappointed with the quality and service.  I also like the flexibility from the chef, always willing to make anything you want.  Check it out, great sushi!!!
The food was pretty good and very reasonably priced. We had a couple sushi rolls with some chicken curry. Everything was solid and I'll be going back for sure.

Food was awesome!  All five of our kids (2-12) loved it.  We ate in the dinning room this time and had sushi, chicken teriyaki, curry, edamame, mussels.  Everything was amazing. Our third visit to this location and we will definitely be back.
Our meals were very good. Atmosphere was a little loud to be able to have a conversation but very fun. Very good service.

Was visiting Vegas and was in the mood for some sushi. We found this place and all I can say is wow. We got there before the dinner crowd arrived and was swayed right away. 

Staff was friendly and even met the manager.

Now the food. Big portions, i got a Spicy Tuna roll  that was made to perfection. Also ordered another spicy  steak platter that was delicious. 

You will not be disappointed at all. Next time i go I'm gonna try and eat the boat platter, yup its a giant boat full of sushi.

Thanks

Wow! Service was awesome.  Food was great.   Most importantly, kids loved it.

Free hot sake with a yelp check in so i had to pair that with a draft Sapporo which was literally ice cold!

I had the sashimi salad - fish was fresh topped with roe and amazing dressing with just the right kick of spiciness.  

Kids had the chicken teriyaki,  beef yakisoba.  Quality was great.  

My lover had spicy beef -adorned with shrooms, peppers, and carrots.  The beef were chunks of steak.

Pricing is reasonable and we left with to-go boxes.

Oh and they had good boba.

This is probably the best Japanese resturants in town. The staffs are really kind and willing to help you to decide what is good. Lots of fresh seafood and great steaks, tasty! Had really good time in here and definitely going back here. Thank you Ohjah!

Giant sushi boat! It was wayyy too much food for 2 people. The 3 rolls (dynamite-sort and 2 simpler options) were great, sea weed salad was delish, but sashimi was not fresh and wayyy too thickly cut. Nice, attentive service.

Whenever I call Ohjah for takeout, they're short on the phone and act like it's an utter inconvenience, even though they advertise takeout. I live right around the corner and tip every time i pick up food, so i don't understand the problem. Tonight was no different and when I picked my food up, I finally asked the man (the same curt person on the phone) if he didn't like takeout orders bc he wasn't very nice. He actually answered that it was a pain when they're busy!! He didn't even apologize and just continued to be rude. The food here is quite good, I order takeout several times per week, and it's one of the better sushi places in town, but they're so rude and clearly don't appreciate my business, so I won't bother with this restaurant again. Many more sushi places that are delicious and make me feel welcome.

This place was so great! The service was amazing, food was delicious, atmosphere is fun and inviting, plus it has the best mochi I have ever eaten! We will definitely be coming back. My husband hates driving far to get good food, this place is definitely worth the drive.
Scrump!!  And mother of god...the "Show me the love" roll. Allow me to drool ok the keyboard...okay I'm done. KAMPAI!

First time here and looks like it will NOT be my last.. Sorry Spicy Tuna, they have a killer tasty Garlic edamame!!! Not to mention they are much closer to my house. Need to try the sake and the beer. Their rolls were also very tasty!! ;)
Really good sushi great presentation came in a boat great family atmosphere 3 rolls for $25 so it's not quite all you can eat but still got filled up for under $100 family of 4
The entertainment was awesome with the chefs cooking in front of you. Flavor of the food honestly wasn't anything too special though. Definitely a fun atmosphere but wish the flavor was better.

Hubby took me here for mother's day, because I love Japanese food! It was great!
No wait (tho we went at I think 9pm) we didn't do the hibachi.
Everything we ordered was great, fresh and delicious. And less expensive then we were expecting. And we got a free small sake!
Highly recommend this place, we will be coming back for sure!

Love the hibachi grill service...however at times the additional parties you are sat with can be ignorant or have no class --- causing the experience not to be a pleasant one, but overall I have dined here several times and will be back. 
Bring your own group if possible
We came here for the hibachi for our 6th wedding anniversary, and had a great time! Fun, friendly, good food, and entertaining. Friendly staff and fun filled atmosphere. We will be coming back again!

Had to eat here twice to fully encompass the whole experience. The first visit was the plain old sushi lunch.  Food was good but nothing spectacular, but spicy tuna rolls, tempura, and edamame all seem to taste the same everywhere after 3 or 4 tall asahis.

Second time I came for the tepanyaki.  The chef was very polite and friendly.  Engaged us but wasn't intrusive in our dinner in any way.  Had the filet and shrimp (both cooked perfectly)

Overall this place is clean, food is above average compared to other sushi establishments, service is great, and it's up the street from where I lay my head.  Only reason I can't give 5 stars is I still have to pay for the food.
Best Japanese food I have tasted in my life. It is extremely authentic and I love the garlic tuna sushi and shrimp tempura.
awesome food and CHEF! there are local spots that a tourist must try in las vegas... and this is one of them! great and entertaining chef :)

So  delicious!  I got  the spider  roll and  the volcano  roll.  The ingredients and  texture of my  two sushi  rolls  were  better than  any other sushi place I have  experienced.  I also ordered the tempura vegetables  and it  was  superb. Very good  customer service.  The  tempura bananas  were  so yummy and the green  tea  mochi.  Definitely recommend!

Placed togo order over phone. Confirmed I was calling the right location. Gave them my name, received order total. 
20 mins later we goto pick up our food. No food is waiting for us. They dont even have my order history. They keep telling me maybe you called the other location. 
I show them my iphone's call history. Clearly shows their phone number. They just look at each other. No apologies received. They said "So, do you want to order again?" No, I dont because I have 3 kids at home including an infant. They can not wait another 30+ mins for me. Thanks but no thanks. 

Will not go back as i also had other issues before this incident.

Burnt New York steak in 10 minutes of me going to pick up and some how over cooked crab in spider roll. Falling apart as I get them home and to top it all off obviously since I'm some white guy i don't use chopsticks to eat sushi they throw plastic forks in the bag for me . Thanks! NEVER AGAIN

We went to dinner here last night with our two small children, ages 3 and 5, and were pleasantly surprised. They treated the children great, and they loved the little chopstick holder that made it possible for them to eat with. The food was great and very reasonable. The only complaint is their onion soup is so-so, but all the other food and service made up for that. We will back very soon

Weeks of enduring the heavenly aromas of teriyaki goodness sizzling away on hearty grills, wafting across the road every time I drove by this restaurant, are what brought me to Ohjah.

As the restaurant was being built, and when it finally opened, I remember thinking (with a raised eyebrow), "Another restaurant in a strip mall... hmm."  I'm very glad for the overly enticing smells coming from this place, otherwise, I may not have found one of my new favorite restaurants, and a true hidden gem.

Let me just say, right off the bat, that a prerequisite for working at this restaurant is to be one of the most genuinely nice and polite people on the face of the earth; I have never seen such friendly service... EVER.  We are greeted promptly and warmly every time we dine here.  The servers are always very attentive, and extra dishes are removed right away.

The restaurant is divided into two sections: the hibachi grill side, and the regular restaurant side (which includes a large sushi bar, booths, and tables).  Although I have only ever eaten on the regular restaurant side, I must say I will definitely try the hibachi side one day because of the sounds, smells, and action coming from that room are incredible! 

The food is also incredible.  Some of the items we have had are: teriyaki scallops, tempura (vegetables and shrimp), numerous sushi rolls (the Black Widow is amazing!), nigiri, sashimi, miso soup, and the house salad.  All were equally delicious (and I'm finding myself strangely addicted to the house salad dressing -- it is mayo based and surprisingly light).  I did find the teriyaki scallops to have a bit too much of the "char" bits on them, but other than that, they were cooked perfectly, and the sauce complimented the flavor of the scallops very well.  The food is always fresh and delivered in a timely manner, and the plating is intricate, balanced, and inviting.  The prices are affordably appropriate as well.

I read in another review that this restaurant would be a great "first date" place to go, and I wholeheartedly agree (for the hibachi or the regular restaurant side).  The ambiance is very pleasant with simple and beautiful artwork on the walls, and low lighting, giving it a romantic feel.  At the same time, it is definitely a very family-friendly restaurant, and a great place to come with friends (especially with $2.50 sake bombs!).

Definitely give this restaurant a try when in Vegas, you won't be disappointed.  And if you live here in Vegas, and don't live close to this particular location, there are a few other locations in town (I have been to the Flamingo location recently, and if I were to review it, I would literally copy and paste this review in for that one as well).
I have eaten here on multiple occasions always Hibachi which is awesome and great fun as well.

Went to ohjahs tonight. It was our first time there. Outside it smells AMAZING so you instantly float your way in. The lighting was perfect which set the mood. My girlfriend and I spilt some sushi which was splendid! Very fresh. If your in the area def stop at this spot to try it out.

My husband and I love this sushi place so yummy!!! 
Excellent customer service and kind people work here ;)
Love this place! My husband and I ordered their sushi boat and it was the perfect amount of sushi. We were both full when we left and the people were extremely friendly. Will definitely be back!
Sushi was good & so was the food. Decent pricing. Not my number 1 sushi place but heck of a lot better than any more easy of Nevada!

One of my favorite sushi restaurants! The food is great, prices are fair and the service is always on.

Chef David at the sushi bar is amazing! He is very creative and always has a smile. The sushi is always fresh and never disappoints. They have Sapporo and Kirin on tap, which is a nice compliment to the fresh sushi. They also have a habachi room that puts on a great show, fills you up and is very reasonably priced (the fried rice in there is awesome!).

Like most of the reviews, the Southern Highlands area really needed a good Japanese restaurant as the area is pretty barren for choice.  Luckily Ohjah opened up in the discreet and empty strip mall across from Albertsons.  The first thing I noticed while entering the place with my wife was the Chinese conversation going on between the hostess and a chef.  Being from Hong Kong, it was a bit of a downer considering we were aching for some quality Japanese food, and seeing the place was ran by Chinese, our expectations immediately dropped.  
    The decor inside is very nice, the lighting is very good, and the staff very polite.  We ordered two lunch sets, the steak teriyaki for myself, and the wife had a steak stir fry.  The waitress tried selling us sushi ( she counted six times throughout our lunch), which seemed ok if we were the least bit interested.  The salad was cold to the point of almost too cold to eat, they need to keep it out of the fridge before serving, but the dressing was decent and could have been worse.  The miso soup is mundane, which probably came in packages you could get at Albertsons or Whole Foods.  The steak teriyaki and stir fry were pretty good, although the tray they brought the food out with smelled of bleach...  Yeah

All in all, it's a decent place.  We just had too high of expectations, thinking a nice Japanese family was setting up shop, only to see frozen to fryer type food.  The real biter is the price, which makes sure we won't be visiting again.

I want to love this place, because it's so close and it's Japanese, however I can't.  I would say to try it though, it's something different in the Highlands area, and it's at least worth a shot.

The sushi rolls here are to die for, so elegantly decorated and every bite wants to you to have more. I thought cream cheese in the middle was a bit odd but now "Dark Cycle" is my favorite roll. The ambiance was great and they had a large TV to watch last nights NBA game which was nice. The reason why I'm giving a 4 star is b/c of the service. Our waitress had to be called over four times to get more water, the check, etc. We even had to get a different guy to get some of those things. I would definitely come back with my handy groupon.

This place is a go to spot for many of my friends and I. 3$ SAKE BOMBS?!? We are broke college students and can get drunk for a low price?? Count is in! Of course they card and make sure we are of age, but they keep the drinks coming! The food is always so great and stays consistent in taste and quality. I've been here at least 10 times for birthdays or just to dinner with my boyfriend and always had a great experience. You choose from a variety of entrees (I always enjoy the hibachi experience) which then comes with a salad, soup and veggies. After the food and a decent amount of drinks you can leave here with a 40$ tab which isn't bad at all. The hibachi chef's and servers are always friendly and keeping our water filled, plates cleared and drinks on deck. They serve sushi here as well, and usually perform some type of show for the hibachi experience. They toss veggies or extras left over from cooking into everyone's mouths and you catch it, which who doesn't want to see their friends get hit in the face with food? Lol. Great restaurant and fun place for a night out or special celebration.
Request Jason as your server, although he is usually at the Durango location! He is the man (:

love this place. cheap sushi, great deal, and FREE sake all this month. They have a groupon deal running right now 20 for 40$
friendly staff :]

First time coming here, my mom recommended this spot. Sushi was served really quick, Danny made me a special roll.

I gave them 4 stars just because the rolls are super tiny, they are still good tho.

I came here with my family and my 4 year old daughter. We all had a blast and so did my daughter. The chef was hilarious and  the food was AMAZING. I got the chicken, filet, scallops, and a sushi roll which were all great. The prices aren't bad at all and they have a nice selection of sake.  Definitely coming back!

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place on a limb from yelp recommendations and I'm so glad that we did! The food is delicious! And is very reasonably priced. Im a huge lover of miso soup, so if the miso is no good I'll never return. Luckily they passed the test! We ordered the holy moly; which if you're a crab lover like me you can't go wrong! I was surprised at how large the potion was and it came with scallops which was a pleasant surprise because I also love scallops. We ordered the golden gate roll which was also very tasty. From just those three items I was so full we had to take home leftovers! I would recommend this place to anyone who is craving sushi and would like high quality food without spending a lot of money. Not to mention we got seated right away!

As a sushi fan on a budget, this place hit the spot. Attentive but not overbearing staff turn out plates of sushi faster than you can fill your sake cup. Pages of special rolls that go beyond the typical Philly Roll and Spider Roll. 

We ordered the Bonsai Dinner which included: 

*2 Special Rolls - Thumbs up for the Widow and Kamikaze Roll (smoked salmon? heavenly.)
*TEN! pieces of Nigiri- no substitutions from the menu but the chef gave us top notch fishies
*Seaweed Salad 

Along with a large Asahi and hot sake our bill was under $60. A much better deal than the ever increasing prices of All-You-Can-Eat on every corner of this sinful city.

This place is divided into two different Japanese restaurants, you can dine on the tappanyaki side or the regular menu side. Both are very delicious. There are so many tappanyaki restaurant and Ohjah has the best. The price is reasonable and the food is very good quality. The chefs are super fun and they definitely bring their unique tricks to grill. As for the regular menu side, it's a little more pricy but the food does not disappoint. I wish they offered All You Can Eat sushi, but they don't so getting the sushi platter or sushi boat would be the next best option. I love their sashimi and nigiri because their fish is really fresh. However, if someone your party doesn't eat sushi, they may not enjoy the selection on the regular menu and it would be more ideal to eat on the tappanyaki side of the restaurant. Lastly, I would have to say that the service is a little better on the regular menu side than the tappayaki side. It seems as though the waiters are a little slower and distracted on the tappayaki side. But on the regular menu side, I have to give two thumbs up to the waiters. Often times you order sushi at restaurants and there seems to be a language barrier or something, but here at Ohjah they usually understand what you're ordering and they rarely get orders wrong. I give the waiters a lot of credit for knowing their menu well.

Well, honestly we would have followed Larry the sushi chef anywhere.... however, this place is pretty cool. Sushi on point, waitress was nice, the place is very clean and inviting. Not having a all you can eat kinda sucks, but ive been to alot of GOOD places that dont need that anyway to fill the seats. We will be back!
Food is always good!! Awesome value!! Price doesn't reflect how good the quality of food is!! No skimping here!!
Fantastic!  That's all I can say.  Will be back for sure.  Close to home. So no fighting The Strip traffic. Good, better, great, awesome.  Everything was super for sure.

We love this place!!! We are always greeted with friendly amazing customer service. The seating times are structured to ensure your group or even just yourself is promptly taken care of. The quality of the food matches it's service. Great place to take relatives visiting or to celebrate birthdays !! We love Fiona!!

Great experience! A friend of mine came in town for the holidays and we found this spot on Yelp. The restaurant was clean, comfortably tempered, and well lit. The front dining area has tables, as well as seating along the bar. We sat in the side room at the hibachi grill. 

The food was great..I ordered the shrimp & chicken hibachi with fried noodles. My friend ordered shrimp and filet mignon with fried rice..everything was cooked to perfection. The hibachi chef, waitress, and bartender were all friendly and accommodating. 

I only gave 4 stars because the price to have Seabass as an add on in your habachi was higher than I would have expected. I would absolutely go back and recommend to others.
great food. great prices. great ambiance. away from the las vegas strip congestion!

Another place I thought I write/wrote an extended review but then, poof ! Nowhere to be seen then I get a little note from yelp saying, hey, you took some pics, how about writing a review.

Well, I am frustrated by the lost lengthy review so I will keep this one brief.  

Went in for late lunch with the gf.  Mistaken impression that hibachi meant it was bbq'ing meats on a lil hibachi either self serve or cooked to order.  Told it was basically teppan style AND not available until evening.   Not happy.  Went ahead and ordered some sushi, soup and a few other unremarkable items.  Nothing stood out for either of us.

No plans to return 

pics posted ages ago
Very yummy and affordable !! The food and service was great !! Tons of great items to choose from . Will definitely be back!!

Went in for sushi with the family. Ordered 4 rolls, the squid appetizer (can't remember the name, kushi something), and the chicken yakisoba. The rolls came out right away. The kushi took about 45 minutes, and the yakisoba over an hour. The rolls were good and so was the kushi, but unfortunately when the yakisoba finally came, I couldn't eat it, it came with the paper from a straw in it. Had it come from my straw, I would've eaten it, but I was unsure where it came from, as it didn't come from our table.  We received a discount and the dish was removed from our check, but after an hour I was really looking forward to trying it. May not be returning..
As for the service, saw waiter a few times in the hour and 45 minutes we were there, but only received one update on the length of time for the yakisoba and kushi.

My husband and I have been coming here for years now. We absolutely love Ohjahs!! The food and service is always amazing. 

Do yourself a big favor - skip Benihanas and go to Ohjah!

Love this place. We dine here about once a month or so. My little grandsons love the food and the chefs. Typical Tepanyaki, but always fun and the staff is friendly. They really make you feel like they are happy that you came in.

Love this place!!!
I have eaten here several times with friends and always had excellent service and great food. I always do the hibachi and my favorite is the Steak and Shrimp. The choices are excellent and they fix it to your preference.

Made a reservation and when my family of 4 showed up they told us they had no room for us. Very poor customer service skills!

....Since my initial post, the owner has reached out to us and apologized for the incident. We are going to give the restaurant another try. I have increased the star rating to a 3 and will readjust again once we dine at the restaurant.

Decided to give this place it's 3rd try... Just because it's close to me... Disappointed AGAIN!!! The food has no flavor... I don't know if it is the chefs or just them catering to the other people at the table.... No show... No fire... No flavor... No nothing!!!!! It's pretty sad when I have to add salt and a half bottle of soy sauce to my own food!!! I will not come here again... Seriously disappointed that they just suck!!!! It ruined my whole night!!!!
This is definitely my favorite steakhouse/sushi in Vegas. The sushi it top quality, the hibachi is amazing, the crew is nice and inviting. Definitely a 5 star establishment.

Goodness. I never wanted to be that person that sits and complains about a place but I am feeling almost despondent about what happened to my family tonight at this Decatur location.

It was my little boys 13th birthday celebration and his father was there with his girlfriend and family and I was on my way to meet them for a 7pm reservation when his father texted me at 7:03 (I was six minutes late) and said "What do you want to eat? They are pressuring us to order NOW. I said "Can you please ask them to wait, I will be there by 7:06, I am 1 mile away" and both my son and his father were texting me back and saying, "they are being really aggressive about making us order now so we will just order for you." 

When I got there and sat down, our cook then showed up with the food prep. Me being the kind of girl that always loves to engage with people, especially in customer service/interactive places like this, grinned at him and said "Yahhh.. Are you going to do some Magic for us tonight?" and then looked at my son to see him smile back. 
    The chef BARKED back at me with a scowl on his face saying " I DON'T DO MAGIC, if you want to see a MAGIC SHOW you go to the MGM GRAND! I cook!". Then he continued to go on and say a few more choice things. At this point I am flat out humiliated and said jokingly "Well I am sorry, I didn't realize it was such an insult to ask you if you were going to perform some magic for us".  
      There was NO SMILE on this man's face and no one at our table was smiling when he said these things.  
  He made me very uncomfortable the entire dinner and that In turn made my poor son uncomfortable.  Twice he slammed down his spatula ( part of the schtick I get it) but it kept scaring me and I would let out a little shriek and laugh and he would just scowl every time it happened.
    Just a miserable experience. He was extra loud, aggressive and just so much negative energy.  Never smiled once. 
 Then they brought out the wrong cake for my son.   We had to remind them and so they brought out the one that we had bought and they sang Happy Birthday to him again, for the second time in a row. I joked to my son that he just aged a year in 5 minutes. 
 We had no sooner taken two bites of our cake when they started bringing out new plates and silverware trying to rush us out of there.  It was apparent they wanted to turn the table over and we felt very unwelcome so we rushed to leave. 
   I would not recommend this place to ANYONE.. EVER.   It's nothing but trying to get as many people in and out of there as quick as possible and they have NO respect for the fact that the customers may want to take a little time to enjoy the hundreds of dollars they just spent.
   I am finding out the name of our COOK and calling to complain to the manager tomorrow. I am sorry but no one deserves to be treated with disrespect when they are spending their hard earned money in their establishment.
The food is okay. I mean this wasn't our first choice everything was closed so it had to do lol. But it was extremely salty and okay sushi. I've had better

Pretty good hibachi place. It's your basic/standard hibachi restaurant, nothing really special lol. They are open late which is great. The hibachi prices are fairly reasonable and the service is great. I feel like the chicken and steak could use a little more flavor, but other than that pretty standard.

I love their miso ramen soup. Flavors hit the spot. The Ohjah fried rice is really good too. My daughter loved their chicken katsu. It's my new go to ramen spot. I also like how you don't feel crowded here.

Omg! Can't forget the first time that my uncle and aunt brought us here for dinner when we visited them.

As we enter, a really nice and cozy type of japanese resto with a dim light approached us. Our server which was also really accommodating, walked us through our table and got our orders.. 

We let my uncle order since they know what's good there besides, it's their go to place whenever they're craving for japanese food..

They served us tea and salad (I love their salad) for starters.. 

Moments later, they served us the order.. it was the "ohjah boat" consist of sushi, sashimi and nigiri.. a tempura and I forgot the other one actually.. I really love the presentation of their boat and all the food tasted so fresh and mouth-watering.. 

(Just a warning: for those of you who are sashimi or nigiri lovers.. there's a parasite warning in the news and you should watch out or just be careful ordering or making some sushi these days, unless you're sure on the resto or where you buy it from..)

but other than that, I believe that this resto is safe and clean! I actually can't wait to go back!

Absolutely delicious!! Great prices, great food, friendly service!! Went in around 6 on a Friday night, no reservations but we were seated immediately!! On the opposite side of town from where we live, but, well worth the drive! We will be back!!!

Wow I don't know what to say we have been here before and it was a descent restaurant but after last night I'll never come back again. My son wanted hibachi so we went here as a family my son ordered chicken with noodles. When it was done I said you like your chicken he said try it with a confused look so I did. I thought it was undercooked so I told the cook he put it back on the flatiron he did for a whole 2 min I tasted it again the chicken was clearly bad it was literally like rubber we could not even bite it. I told them and they didn't care I even had a complete stranger sitting next to us try it and she was wow that is awful. I talked to our waitress she was like well I'll remove the chicken but I have to charge you for the noodles I'm thinking wow what customer service. I then ask to talk to the manager he was like well we took it off the bill I'm like that not the point the point is that now my son has nothing to eat at that point i was disappointed in this place so before we leave my son says can I have a refill of apple juice and they say we have to charge you there's no free refills even after they just screwed up his meal so wrong. The worst customer service I've ever experienced horrible service. I highly recommend you stay far away from this place.
Phenomenal food!! The sushi was amazing & so was the teriyaki beef wrapped around cream cheese with green onions!!! Yummy!!! The service was wonderful & the restaurant was so clean!!

Went there for their Hibachi and enjoyed the show & food. Returned there today for their regular menu and we were not disappointed. Good food and service with avg prices. 

If your looking looking for a nice Japanese restaurant or a good Hibachi show this is the place to go. This is going to be a regular spot for us.

I love this place, the food is great and servers are friendly. I had my birthday dinner here and ordered their boat.....which I have to admit is worth the price. The sushi chef was also really cool he made us a  small dish of one of his specials for us to taste which was awesome. I highly recommend this place and will be here more often.
Great quality with great price.  Their dishes are more fusion Japanese than traditional, but I enjoyed it.  Sashimi grades are excellent
I been before and thought it was under priced, so today i'm taking a few friends with me. yeay

How did this place receive 4 stars?? I came in on a Thursday night after work at the Blue diamond location  and the service I can say was great but was totally subpar food. I enjoyed my Sapporo bottled beer but the filet and subsequent rice and vegetables sucked!!! The dipping sauces were watery and not flavorful so I couldn't remedy my overdone medium rare filet which was medium to medium well now at best. I have reviewed many restaurants on yelp fairly- and tonite this place was horrible. I hate giving bad reviews but ohjah please do something with your hibachi grill food!!! It is marginal at best!!
Great, fun place. Good food. Nice atmosphere. Very reasonable prices. Good-sized portions. Highly recommend on a first date, spouse date or for a big birthday celebration.

The best sushi place in Vegas! We like to get the ohjah boat. It's amazing! $50 with three rolls, sashimi, and nigiri. The fish is always fresh. Service is excellent! We will definitely be back again and again!

I've been here a couple times before and I always felt like the man at the door, not in uniform who I assume is either the manager or the owner of the place is kinda unfriendly, but today he was just straight up mean and rude to me and my little nephew. We came in around 6:30 for dinner and I realized the place was packed as soon as we walked in. I saw him as I entered and asked if we could have hibachi for 2. He said "No, we're full but there are tables out here". I thought his response came across very short and uninviting. I promised my nephew who I don't get to see often a fun dinner where he would get to see the hibachi chef do all kinds of cool tricks and now that's not happening so I'm trying to figure out if my nephew wants something else there like sushi or teriyaki or ramen, etc...and while I'm asking my nephew what he wants that man rudely interrupted me: "are you eating here?" And I swear there was no one waiting behind us. It's not like we were holding up the line. Anyways, my nephew said he wanted sushi so we stayed and got one of the tables in the regular dining area. We got water right away but then sat for about 15 minutes before that same man came to check on us and take our order. As I ordered the chicken teriyaki, he asked if I wanted white rice or fried rice. I turned to ask my nephew if fried rice is ok since he'll be sharing some of my food, and he was a little distracted so before he could answer my question, the man just grabbed the menus on the table from under my arm and walked away angrily. I thought that is extremely unprofessional and disrespectful of customers. His attitude was just indescribably rude and so uncalled for towards me and my little nephew. If he doesn't have the patience to serve, he shouldn't be working in a customer service job. First of all, the food is ok, not that impressive to begin with. I've been to many different teppanyaki places before and I've had better.  Second, I'm paying to eat there. It's not like I'm there begging for free food. I didn't pay to get treated like that. I am extremely and absolutely angry, disgusted and displeased with the offensive service I received at this Ohjah today and will definitely NEVER COME BACK!

Hibachi is the Medieval Time's of Japanese cuisine. Dinner AND a show? ok.

So this review is only based off the hibachi part of the restaurant.  We have to go back and try the standard menu.

The chefs are funny and engaging! Catch a shrimp in your mouth flipped with the spatula right off the grill! I was the only one on our table to try, everyone else just had it flipped on their plate; When in Rome! err Japan?

As part of the Hibachi grill menu you get: 
1. Onion soup (nice little starter with light onion flavor). 
2. Salad with ginger dressing (warning: they drown the salad in dressing, so maybe ask for it on the side; but I love the dressing so no complaints here)
3. Sauteed veggies.
4. Fried rice or noodles.
5. Your choice of protein. I recommend to spend a little extra and getting the Filet  over  the other steak cuts.  Even though I ordered my NY strip medium, because it was then sliced before plating it kept cooking more and came closer to well done.  The Filet was more tender and ordered medium-rare came to your plate closer to medium but Delicious! I enjoy a good surf & Turf so I also had the calamari which was just ok, Someone in our table ordered lobster and scallops.  The scallops looked amazing so I will try that next time, Lobster looked a little small but what can you expect from a Hibachi grill.

The rice was flavorful and the veggies were delicious, I love me some mushrooms.  (why was the mushroom invited to the party? Cause he was a Fun-gi!).

 
We definitely will return. The bill ran about $40-$50 for two. Not bad for a date night (don't worry, it was an impromptu date night, I'm no cheap date giver). The sig-other definitely enjoyed the experience and the food.

Did i like it? Oh-jah (oh-yea) I definitely did.  Horrible attempt of a pun. Sorry.

DELICIOUS!!  Really great meal here that started with the sparkling sake with white peach. Yum!! It could have easily been too sweet but it wasn't.  

We started with a spicy tuna roll and that was also really good. And of course the hibachi - perfection. Filet, shrimp, scallops - all great. 

We loved it and will be back the next time we're in Vegas!

Went to ohjah last night the flamingo location i said id never go back to that location because the first time i went there i told my bf i feel something crawling on my feet i was wearing flip flops he thought i was crazy until i cock roach crawled over my hand on the table when we mentioned it they didnt seem to care. Tonight we went back the waitress took our order my friend order the steak and shrimp i ordered the chicken w rice AND noodles my friend never got her shrimp and i didnt get my rice. When we asked our waitress again she didnt seem to care. My rice was whatever because i had noodles but half my friends meal was missing and she shared her rice with me. I dont know if the customer service is below what it should be because they are growing so fast or what but we have been going to the Decature location since it opened.
Always great food and service. So fun to have the hibachi chef cooking in front of you. Prices are great for such a great meal.

Ohjah has been my go-to Hibachi restaurant for years. The food is excellent, the prices are reasonable, and the service and presentation are always outstanding. They obviously take great pride in their work there. I usually order the Hibachi basic with steak and scallops.

I was excited that I was able to to talk my hubby into ANYWHERE I could get a bite of sushi so we decided to try out this new Hibachi spot in our area. 

Our friend met us there and hubby and I got there it was about 5pm and upon opening the door, there was no one there. No one. Customers or hostess. 
Ummmmmm......so I walked to the left a little and realized that the hibachi area was around the corner in a different room.

We walked ourselves around the room then found hibachi area.
I posted several pics.

Honestly it reminded me of the "ol'school" Benihana.......I just was not impressed. You have zero servers and if you get water or a drink you are lucky. The grill master Ven was suppose to be the best but just acted like he did not care that night.

I got the Sushi Fiji and hubby got the Prime hibachi. Mine was just a pile of unfrozen bay scallop looking fried madness and hubby kept telling Ven "NO I'M ALLERGIC TO SHELLFISH" when he kept trying to throw shrimp in his mouth.

Our friend order a roll and saki......he was also not impressed.

It is next to a new Lee's Liquor's that has craft beers.....that's another ball of GOOD YELP wax :)

Went with my colleagues (8 people) around 5PM and was seated right away. It took some time for the chef to show up but we didn't mind since we had our drinks and the free sake after checking in Yelp. I had the New York steak hibachi which was ok. Service was great but their sake menu was very limited. 

Bottom line: great service, inexpensive, average food and limited sake options.

This place is our go to for Japanese teppanaki. They don't cook with any msg and that is always what makes my stomach hurt at the other places that are similar. I wish their sushi was better but we aren't here for sushi! Chefs are definitely enjoyable ! We will keep coming back

Not a good experience tonight. Usually everything is great but tonight was pretty bad. We took our friends and their 11-year-old son for the first time to experience the restaurant.  Our chef was very nice but was boring. He did the volcano trick and the eggroll trick but that was it. Our friends son was really looking forward to the shrimp tossing but we never got it. Also, my husband ordered the Seabass and it was absolutely disgusting!!! It was a very bad piece of fish that smelled AWFUL!!!! He didn't eat it. And when we let the chef know, he said he would let the manager know. But then we had a remind the waitress, who came back and took it off the bill. But he was never asked if he was still hungry or wanted anything else. They brought out the check and were never offered dessert. Looking forward to the Pecos and windmill restaurant opening up. We'll be back, because we've always had a good time here.

Took my niece nephew and son here. The kids liked it. Food was pretty good, up to par with the rest of these type of places. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I'd like to come here with friends next time have some drinks and a fun night. I would recommend this place.

Always fast service here!
The seafood yakisoba and the lasagna roll is my favorite!
For a fun date , try the hibachi grill!

I love this place! It's right next to my house! I brought so many friends and family over here! I order rolls to go almost every week! Stuff is always nice and happy to see you:) I recommend to check it out! It's good for 2 or big party!!!!

New japanese restaurant in the southwest part of LV. Bf and I came out here and were very pleased. Since it newly opened, they had a special going on. 3 specialty rolls for $54 bucks. Overall, rolls were decent. Decor is very zen, and a lot bigger than most sushi restaurants located in this part of town. You also have the option to do hibachi, which we still ave yet to do.

Too good, plain and simple.  I've been going to Benihana for as long as I can remember and Ohjah is right up there with the big boys without the high ticket price tag.  The hibachi is freaking awesome, not to mention they have great sushi deals too...must try "The Boat", still haven't gotten a chance but it is a sushi display of pure beauty.  The service is always so friendly and quick, they always make sure you have what you need and they encourage that you check-in for your free house sake.  I absolutely love that Ohjah opened up five minutes away from where I live and that I don't need to get dressed to the nines to go there.  Love it!

I'm a fan of Japanese steakhouses so I was excited to try this place. Dinner started with soup and salad which comes with every teppanyaki meal. The salad dressing is amazing!!!! I am not a fan of salad, but I loved this!! It is really sweet and doesn't taste like any other dressing I've ever had. Each order comes with soup, salad, vegetables, and the choice of fried rice, noodles, or steamed rice.

The basic entree is $8.95 with the items listed above, then you add whatever else you want. For example, I ordered Filet Mignon and Shrimp Teppanyaki which added $13 to the basic price. I like the menu style because it is  "Mix & Match" so you can create the perfect meal.

The steak was delicious and very good quality. The shrimp however had a very strong shrimp taste which I don't like. (I am very picky about shrimp!) After dipping them in one of the sauces provided it was better. Finally, the fried rice was delicious!!

Overall: Delicious and inexpensive teppanyaki dinner! I would say they are in the top 3 :)
Absolutely awesome experience! This was my 7 year Olds first experience at a hibachi grill and our chef Eddie "murphy" made her smile ear to ear from start to finish.  Thank you Ohjah!

The service by our waitress Sally was amazing. She was friendly, efficient and made us feel like we were the most important people in the place.  Food came out fast and it was delicious. We will be back for sure...a lot
One of my favorite places to go to for Asian food. The presentation is awesome and the atmosphere is always cozy and fun. Food is unbelievable and the prices are so reasonable.

7 of us went on a Sunday afternoon about 4:30 to the hibachi grill. Within a half hour, they were full so just a heads up you can make a reservation. When you do, request Van for your chef. His excellent skills provide lots of entertainment and the dishes were excellent. We had filet, New York steak, chicken teriyaki. I requested my filet be cooked rare which is somewhat difficult to do when they cut it up on a grill, but it was cooked perfectly. Very tender and juicy. The others enjoyed their meals as well. The onion soup is delicious and even the kids ate it although we didn't tell them it was onion. Loved the fried rice and the crisp tasty vegetables. Looking forward to the opening of their new restaurant November 15 as it will be a bit closer to home.

I highly recommend that you pick the restaurant instead of the tepankayi where they put on a show and cook infront of you. The quality ofmthe food on the restaurant side is amazing and very delicious. The other side , on other note, tasted like it was smothered with MSG. You pay for the entertainment thats why it's so expensive. The servers were very nice except for the manager. It was the third time I ate there and it was a little busy than usual. I saw the manager cussing and giving attitude at the servers and COSTUMERS! He was so unprofessional! Other than that, food is great!

Came here w my family and had hibachi. We were seated promptly and everyone was friendly. The menu had lots of choices for sushi and hibachi. They even surprised my mom with a happy birthday dessert. It was great food, great service, & a great time.  It was nice that we could go somewhere as a family.  My brother has a 4 year old son and things can get loud as we all talk with him & play with him.

Ohjah gets 5 stars for the accommodations, friendliness, clean restaurant, professionalism of the staff, quality of food, & prices.

We were seated promptly but we did arrive at 6:00pm. When we left at 7:00-7:30, there was a wait and small crowd at the door.

The entire staff was very pleasant and friendly. Food was amazingly delicious! I loved the pomegranate sake, just yummy. Not only did our waitress check back with us more than once, but the waiter and manager did as well. The lighting was great, music was at perfect level, and they were even showing The World Cup on TV. I am impressed with the entire experience. I highly recommend them. People that know me, know I am not one to give 5 stars, be today, it was well deserved!
Had the Special Rolls Combo: Tiger, Sweet Heart, and Crispy Tuna, more than enough food. CRISPY TUNA absolutely loved! It has all my favorites spicy tuna, tempura seaweed, eel sauce, & more. Delish!
Very good !  We ate the sushi boat.. it was so fun.  The manager was nice.  The building has great lighting.. in all the right places... everything was great!

We went here for late lunch. The hibachi lunch was delicious and very reasonably priced. It was empty when we got there so it felt a bit more intimate. The chef was skilled and had a likeable personality. The staff was also nice and went out of their way to chat us up when they found out we were local. I had the chicken and shrimp and my friend had beef and chicken. Along with that were the regular sides of fried rice and veggies (mushrooms, zucchini and onion). The meal also included miso soup and ginger dressing salad. Everything was delicious and reasonably priced. I plan on returning, but during off hours because it sounds like this place gets packed on weekend nights.
Head off the strip a few miles for the best hibachi in Vegas and for an amazing price. Make a reservation on weekends and don't forgot to check in on Yelp for a free small sake.

My uncle picked this up to go for my mom and i. We really enjoyed the sashimi plate of 20 pieces. All of the pieces were very think and very fresh. The fish practically just melted in my mouth. The 20 pieces were not enough for all three of us, so we ended up going back and getting two rolls, Ohjah roll and the Las Vegas roll. I would definitely say stick with the sashimi. I will come back when I'm back in town most definitely

I came with my sister and brother in law to eat dinner. I ordered the fried rice with stir fry vegetables and the Geisha house steak, which tasted great. The Hibachi cook was very professional and service was great.

Ohjah is the perfect sushi spot for us in the southwest. They have a great selection of rolls and lots of options for those who prefer their meals fish free. The main dining room is always fairly quiet and dark which sets up for a nice little romantic dinner. I prefer to go a little bit later to miss the crowd. We haven't had their hibachi yet but we have been dying to try because every time we're there, it sounds like they're having a great time!

We've been driving past this for over and finally decided to give it a go. Soo glad we did. Very nice interior and atmosphere. Excellent quick and friendly service. Food was great and the price was incredibly reasonable. Family friendly as well. Overall a great experience and will return often.

Service was excellent and the prices are great....but the food quality was lacking a little. Went here to celebrate a friend's birthday dinner and my salmon was over cooked. Also the rice wasn't as fluffy as it should be. Maybe next time we will just sit at the sushi bar...

I've been to Ohjah several times for both their sushi and hibachi style food and I've always been pleased with their food. I always make a reservation as I am not one to wait long especially if I'm hangry! 
The menu has a variety of sushi options which is similar to most places, but their sushi specials is what makes us choose this restaurant from the rest! 
My family loves the hibachi style dinner- very entertaining and the food is delicious!
The menu looks a la carte for teppanyaki, but it's really a build on price.  You get a salad and soup with your meal and it's perfect.  The chef was great and friendly,

These folks are very nice and accomodating. We came late at 1030 and we were taken care of in a very professional manner. The food is delicious and portions are substantial. We will definitely return and try other menu items. I had the sushi special and the nigiri and sashimi were really fresh and the rolls tasty. Hats off! A winner on Blue Diamond and Decatur.
Love this place! Excellent food, great service at an affordable price. Convenient location if you live in the southwest.
its ok not great but it all depends on what you are going for.  service is 'ok' and food is ahhhh..... i go cuz my kids enjoy the fire works

First time here tonight and everything was so wonderful. Came as a party of 8 and didn't know what to expect. I was confused to how to order at first but the waitress explained how the habachi worked.

The chef we had that cooked our food was hilarious and joked with me a lot. 

Food was just delicious. And the service we got from all the staff was amazing. I believe the manager even came around to see if everyone was happy and doing good.

They even brought out a cake for the birthday girl that was with us.
Our family loves this restaurant , they serve great food and very entertaining.

For the best experience sit at the sushi bar and get to know the chefs.  They offer great sushi rolls with many to choose from.  The sushi boat is a great value and comes with so much stuff.  Staff is friendly and it's always clean.   The boba tea is very good here too.  Awesome uni when it's available.
Terrific hibachi, among the best I've ever had.  Or maybe I was just really, really hungry.  Either way, I'll definitely be going back sometime.

We decided to give this place another chance after a not so pleasant experience with one of the chefs last time. The owner was very understanding and set up a reservation for us to come back. We came for a late lunch around 3:30pm before the rush. The manager greeted and sat us on the hibachi side and the staff was very accommodating. We had Keith as our chef (aka "Hello Keithy" he said, which was pretty catchy) and he remembered us from a previous time. He's always very nice, friendly, and in a happy mood which is always a good sign. I do think that the staff's mood is a big part of setting a guest's experience. He was able to add extra garlic to my meal without acting like it was a hassle (which the previous chef was not happy about when I asked last time). My friend and I both had the shrimp and NY steak and it was very flavorful and well prepared. Next time I come in I'll definitely request Keith again.

I'm never disappointed with food here, and as long as you call in advance to see if there's a wait for teppanyaki... then you'll love it!

The menu looks a la carte for teppanyaki, but it's really a build on price. If you're not good at math, you can rack those prices up quickly! The chef was great and friendly, which is needed when you basically have dinner with strangers! Lmao 

I'm not a fan of sake, but you'll get a free shot when you check in!

Tiger roll- spicy, of course, and you can taste the freshness!!!!

Yellowtail sashimi- fresh! I asked for jalapeño on mines and it was perfect

My husband and I decided to check out Oojah the other night for a late lunch/early dinner. I loved the decor of the restaurant. Very nice looking! The staff was all very friendly and accommodating as well. 

We made it in time to enjoy their lunch box specials, which were smaller and cheaper versions of their dinner boxes. I got the chicken katsu box while my husband got the beef teriyaki box. I couldn't believe the size of the boxes when they were brought to our table! Not only was my portion of the chicken katsu huge, but it also came with miso soup, salad, pork dumplings, and three California rolls (perfect because I am pregnant and can't have traditional sushi). The food was great and very filling! 

I felt the prices were fair for what we ordered and even looking at the menu, the sushi prices I felt were reasonable as well. 

We'll definitely be visiting Oojah again and I can't wait until I am able to try out their sushi!
This place is amazing. The seafood is fresh and the flavors are amazing! It's definitely my go to sushi restaurant!! The service is always great!

We went here for lunch on Sunday. The lunch box specials include Miso soup, salad, pot stickers, California roll, rice, and your "entree". My chicken teriyaki lunch box was under $7.00 so I expected the lunch box to be small. (I spend more at taco bell for a combo meal.) By the time I was finished with my meal, you had to roll me out of there! It was plenty of food! The decor is beautiful, the food tasted fresh and it came out relatively fast. I would have given it 5 stars but I had to ask each time I wanted my drink refilled and that was a little irritating because the server didn't come around at all once the food was out.

I have been here numerous times for the hibachi & restaurant side dining. The hibachi here is so delicious & every chef is so entertaining & personable. They do all the standard hibachi tricks but also new ones every once in a while. Our last chef said he youtubes videos, so you know they take pride in their work. The restaurant food is also delicious, they serve sukiyaki which is hard to find & love their sushi rolls. Make a reservation for hibachi for sure bc it's always packed. The restaurant side mid week is fine for walk ins but make a reservation for weekends. I have a large family so I always call for a reservation even if we're already on our way to make things easier.

After a genuine message from the owner after my review - we decided to give this place one more chance.  

Came in last night and opted for the dining area instead of the hibachi room.  Service was a HUGE improvement from my last visit.  

Only Downfalls:

- they charged us for an extra order of edamame - not going to complain over $3 
- they charge $1 extra per roll to sub. soy paper


We will be back thanks to Saly & Peter to give the Hibachi room another shot as well.

The food was whatever. If you don't like teriyaki make sure to tell them. The tricks were cool though and they did a couple I never saw before. If you really want to go to hibachi, it's an easy neighborhood choice.

Came here for sushi last night, did not know what to really expect but to our surprise it was quite pleasant. My g/f and I split a blue diamond special, the sashimi and nigiri were good in a generic way. I suggest to get the white tiger roll it is fantastic and the spider man roll was good too. Onion soup was not hot and was kind of disappointing according to my g/f and the chicken fried rice was also so-so. Overall it was a good evening, the Sushi Chef that was serving us was super friendly and helpful.
Nice atmosphere and good food. The entertainment is great. Something different and exciting for a night out. I had the filet and it was cooked perfectly.

After a day losing money at the casinos, it was time to pause and celebrate my sister's belated birthday with some dinner...she wanted Japanese and this was one of the closest Japanese restaurants from Silverton and Yelp had some favorable reviews. 

We opted for the hibachi/teppanyaki and were seated promptly, drinks served, orders taken and ready to dine and be entertained by our teppan chef. Our chef was engaging and entertaining. Sitting with two locals who frequented the place further bolstered our confidence that we made the right choice for dinner...well, they were pretty drunk with multiple sake bombs by the time they started eating so maybe anything will taste good after that. Food turned out to be good and my steak was tender and yummy. Pleasantly surprised by the quality and flavor of the food...it wasn't too salty as is the case with most teppan style cooking. A good find!

I guess drunkenness doesn't really dull one's taste buds after all.

man this place is awesome. first time coming here, didnt know what to expect. first off, theyre appetizer serving is a lottttt. theres more meat than the breading. really pleasing. entre was great. poooowerfuul flavor. cant say anything else, but you have to give this place a try.

Wonderful service and great food!!! We have been there several times. All the kids always enjoy the show the chef puts on. I wish they would change it up or personalize the shows... after a few times you don't even pay attention you just wait for the food. Still worth going even if you know all of the laughs jokes and tricks. Always a lot of food and even enough to take home. Coupons are always available in the newspaper that is delivered to the mailbox weekly

What a great restaurant. I went with my boyfriend for our anniversary, the chef was amazing and the food was even better. The customer service was exceptional, the waiters came to pick up our trash and plates while we ate so we wouldn't have a mess and refilled our glasses constantly.

Great service. Very attentive staff.

Veggie egg rolls very tasty and it seems they give good attention to the main dishes.

Typical fare.

Warning: 

The plum wine is VERY sweet....like Moscato on steroids - and I enjoy Moscato. Sure, I expected sweetness but had to dilute it with water and ice to drink it as I don't sip wine. Did I say VERY sweet...almost syrupy. Guess I should have known better...my bad.

Had the green tea ice cream. Will not try that again.  The "crust" in which the ice cream is wrapped was not to my taste so I mostly ate the green ice cream...not bad on it's own but not a fav.

Nonetheless, they pulled out 4 stars for an overall grade to be fair.

BTW...

It was March and they had a fully decorated and lit Christmas tree up.  Jokingly, ask the waitress about it and she had no idea other than to say "...no room to store it."  Now that was funny. The tree was right by our booth. Pleasantly unexpected.

My family and I love this place. The prices are great and the food is amazing. My son has food allergies and they always make sure to take care of him when we go. The cooks are entertaining and the wait staff is very courteous and attentive. 2 thumbs up :)

Just finished our dinner here and made this one of faves for taking out of town friends and family to.  We were warmly greeted by the host and seated immediately in the teppan grill room, which appears to seat about 60-70 at six different stations.  They call it a "hibachi" dinner. 

If anyone has ever eaten at Benihana's or the Nijo Castle (Newark, CA), I recall paying about $25-30 per Teppan entree.  Here, you pay $8.95 for the Hibachi basics: soup, salad, rice (steamed or fried) or fried noodles.  Then you choose your add ons or what they call "mix or match" which is your proteins.  Chicken teriyaki is $4.95, NY steak is $5.95, filet mignon is $7.55, shrimp $5.75 and so on,  There is also salmon, $5.75 scallops ($7.55),  Lobster tail (6 oz.) for $15.95, Kobe beef $48.95.  They also offer 3 basic entree items (not included is the lobster tail, Kobe beef or Halibut) + the Hibachi basics for $28.95.
