I ordered the scallops and chicken, the wife, steak and it is still cheaper than other similar restaurants.  The quality of the food is good. Portions were decent.  The soup was mild in flavor, the salad though was disappointing. The dressing was watery and you could tell the salads were pre-made earlier in the day. 

Pre-tip for our family of four with 2 kid's hibachi entrees (steak & chicken) with sodas and  a large Sapporo was $76.

They do offer lunch. sushi, sashimi, nigiri, and a good selection of Japanese entrees in their regular dining room, which has a sushi bar.

We're hoping this restaurant stands the test of time and continues to flourish at its location since there is no other restaurant like this in the SW part of town,  They also have a location in Pahrump.

This is my favorite teppenyaki place in Vegas. They have great prices, delicious sushi selection and fantastic, attentive service. We used to frequent ohjah about once a week, but it got pricey. 

You can order the main teppenyaki dish for $8.95 and then add on your meat selection, whether it is filet or shrimp or both. 

The salad dressing is to die for... I wish I could just drink it. Their sushi is so fresh And they have a great assortment of rolls. 

Definitely will be back soon!

Super bomb! Ordered the whole menu! Good prices too! Steak, filet mignonette, scallops, shrimp! Me and my friend ordered 5 items each and 2 sakes and the bill was $100. Not bad at all. They had to roll me out of there
Ordered the beef yakisoba lunch box. Yakisoba lacked flavor.

Tonight's dinner at the Sushi bar was INCREDIBLE. We had California Roll, Dragon Roll, Rock and Roll and Lobster Roll. It was positively sex on a plate. I will eat here 100 times more. The sushi here will leave you begging for mercy!
I love coming here now. Customer service has gotten better. The fish is fresh. Go sit at the sushi bar and ask for chef Larry. Let him surprise you with his creations.

This is a very fun place to enjoy a nice dinner. We sat at the teppanyaki area and the food was prepared very well and we got some great entertainment as well. Our chef was a bit of a comedian (in a good way) and me made our experience a very pleasant one. This location is pretty empty during weekdays so I've never needed a reservation.

WOO HOO for Habachi!!! Yo I have had my fair share of teppanyaki and Ohjah serves up a pretty good one. Now I know some of you might not find this too exciting but forget all that if you would to have a go to local habachi or sushi steak house here it is. I have to say this location didn't seem or look like it has a big enough space inside for this but it did. Located next to Lee's Liquor and Papa Murphy pizza it also doesn't look like there is much parking. But have no fear there is plenty on the side and in back. 

Upon entering you will find yourself in the restaurant/sushi bar side. They have a completely separate room for habachi next door. Our service girl was nice and the chef was really entertaining, I was very stoke we got the guy we did because the cook before him didn't look like he wasn't having such a great night. We came here for my Birthday celebration and everyone got a mix plate and I ordered the Ohjah Boat with sashimi, special sushi rolls, nigiri and seaweed salad.

The lobster, filet and shrimp teppanyaki was cooked and seasoned so perfectly. Meat was tender...not dried and tough like (Benihana's) and the shrimp and lobsters had great texture as well not chewy or fishy. The fried rice was yummy very garlicy just how I like it. I also got the Sushi and Shashimi boat for myself. Which is pretty awesome and more then enough food! come with 3 specialty sushi rolls of your choice and 10 pcs of nigeri 6 pcs of shashimi and a side of seaweed salad. BOMB!

All in all I loved this place and will be back and how cool is getting your sushi served on a freaking Boat Man?!?!.....Super cool!

Our son picked this spot for dinner to celebrate his birthday. We decided to have hibachi. Our chef was amazing, and the staff was great. They sang happy birthday to my son, and he loved it! The food was awesome!

We really liked this place. Nothing too fancy. The chefs were really great! We had hibachi. The salad and soup were delicious as were the vegetables, rice, and noodles. Very fast and pleasant service.
Love love love this place! My new go to when I hit Vegas. These sushi bar sheds are awesome!

Great service and amazing hibachi. Went there last night for dinner and was really surprised with this place. The food were so yummy and the chef really funny and skilled. I had a fried sushi and it was not good. So, I cannot judge on it once I had only one kind of sushi, i wouldn't order any other sushi. But would go back 1000ish times just for the hibachi. I had salmon, my hubby had the steak+chic OMG so tasty!!!

Family and I tried this restaurant for the first time! It was nearby and decided to try. Comforting atmosphere, great server(PETER) plus he also ordered for us since we didn't know what to try first. Great sushi! I am definitely going back!

I have been coming here for 2 years and have experienced average to amazing food
However this last visit turned out to be the worst dining experience I ever had
My husband orders Kobe beef and I usually order seafood
Well Kobe beef was so bad it was inedible and the scallops tasted like rubber lobster was so salty I would of had high blood pressure if I ate it
The chef was obviously new he kept dropping things while doing his show
And the manager did absolutely nothing but apologize and bill the entire amount 
I will never eat there again they lost a good customer

Great Hibachi and Pad Thai! Staff is friendly, nice, and quick.  Great neighborhood atmosphere.  Live hibachi style seating or just sit in the front for a quick bite.  Food is always fresh and delicious.  I completely recommend this little hideaway.  It has become one of our favorite places to eat.  Thank you!

This place will make you yell, "Ohjah!!!!!"

This is the best dinner show I have been to in Las Vegas. It's also the best value. Forget the Tournament of Champions or Blue Man Group, this is the place to be (and it's family friendly!). Have you ever seen someone throw an egg and crack on on the edge of a spatula without humpty dumptying it (it's a word)? What about lighting an onion volcano on fire with their finger? I have and it was awesome. Our Hibachi chef has been cooking Hibachi for years and it showed not only in the entertainment, but in the food.He was self deprecating and very funny, but more importantly the New York steak and filet were cooked perfectly. No, Seriously, melt in your mouth perfection. The chicken was also fantastic. We took our kids with us and he took the time to cook their portion of the steak slightly longer and cut the steak to the perfect size for even the tiniest of our enthusiastic eaters. We also had a killer waitress who kept our drinks topped off the entire time and was very sweet to our children. 

I've done hibachi at many restaurants. This was by far my favorite hibachi experience ever. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Yoooo! Ohjah gets a big fat noooojah from me! I wanted to order the hibachi steak with fried rice but i was informed you can only get hibachi steak at the hibachi grill side. Fair enough, i was seated at a table so i just ordered their dinner ny steak that came with all parts of a hibachi steak minus fried rice and minus the hibachi. What my server brought out( i dont know his name but he was asian and skinny, so ill call him Chad) was this abysmal excuse of a ny steak. It was thin as hell, like it just got done fasting for 48 hrs and THEN ran a marathon. The taste was non-existant. For $17, you would expect a decent steak, lets just say that memo was not given to ohjah. The meso soup that came with it was awful. The salad that came with it was very good because of their dressing. So if you want a tasty salad, try ohjah. But If you want a good steak come to my backyard and ill whip one up on the barbie! Nooojah is a no go but Chad was the shit!:)

Tip-top  Teppanyaki! It's one of our fav dinner spots. Van is the master of hibachi showmanship, you're extra lucky if he's your chef. The prices are super reasonable, & nice combo menu choices.
 There's also  a second restaurant side for regular dinning. A variety of Japanese cuisine & sushi rolls. We've never had a bad meal there.
Ohjah is always fantastic. The good is always perfectly cooked, no matter who the chef is. We eat there on a regular basis and it never disappoints!
I absolutely love this place. We've tried many sushi places around the area and this is the best. Best service best food best everything. Yall gotta come here!

My favorite Hibachi! Food is always amazing! The chefs put on a great show! My kids love this place. We often come here on special occassions. It is a bit pricey but I believe you can share. I've also tried their sushi and the Blue Diamond Roll is my favorite. Cant wait to go again!

Great Hibachi! I had the 3 item special, chicken , filet and shrimp! The filet mignon was phenomenal! I called for take out, Peter was very polite and patient with me, being my first time ordering. He recommended the special which saved me money and  it was plenty of food for two of us. Yummy
I always have to order the King Salmon roll, probably one of the best rolls I've tasted in years!  Everything else is pretty good, but this roll to me is magic.

Not your authentic japanese food. Shrimp tempura crunch roll...not fresh and not good. Veggie fried rice was bland....who ever had the bright idea of throwing bean sprouts in them??? A bit too overpowering. Never order it again!!! Korean kalbee...very fatty. Service was fast but not attentive.  If I come back, which is slim to none...I think their hibachi food is what their known for.

Great food good ambiance. Will definitely be back when I'm craving habachi & sushi rolls!!! I had the Blue Diamond sushi combo my husband had the hibachi combo with steak, scallop & shrimp. Our friends had Kobe beef and everything was great but $48 on top of the $8.95 is pretty stiff especially when the Kobe was such a thin slice! All n all it was pretty good!

The rolls we ordered were cold and the sushi was small . The rice was really sticky. It was a little on the high side when it came to the price,the sauce in the rolls was too sweet.  The waitress was hard to communicate with but she was nice. I don't think I will becoming back here again there are other sushi joints in the area that are better when it comes to food service & prices.

This place is in our neighborhood and is very delcious! They have a special it's buy 2 rolls get one free! Rocky is so funny and nice he's one of the guys who creates the delicious rolls! Whenever I need a quick bite I come here!

There are many places like this in Los Angeles but I rather come back here. Not only is the food priced great it is also very pleasing. Van was our cook and I couldn't have been any happier with his skill of cooking.

I wasn't so excited to go to this restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised!  Everything was very clean and fresh. I am picky and I was able to trust the chef. He cooked everything perfect and flavored to my liking without my making any special requests.  The service was excellent!  I have never been in and out of teppanyaki so fast! I was hungry, and I was fed!  I've been going to the same teppan restaurants for years, I think I have a new favorite =)

I love this little local restaurant. I have been to another location and this one multiple times and have not left disappointed. They offer sushi at the sushi bar or anywhere in the restaurant and I find it to be of great value and excellent quality.  The rolls are large and filling, definitely worth grabbing if you stop in.  I also recommend the teppanyaki style dining, it is extremely affordable and is of much better quality and appeal than any of the large competitors like Benihana's or other teppan style restaurants in town. If you want to avoid the teppan, you can just grab an entree off the regular menu. We have tried many of the different options and all of them are greatly priced and extremely filling. Many times me and my wife will just split an entree and some rolls and leave their over filled with left overs. If you're ever looking for some good Japanese, I highly recommend it.
Precios decentes ambiente agradable y buena comida, lo recomiendo, solo hay que hacer reservacion.

This place is always good and the hibachi is such a good deal. 

Chefs are always friendly and entertaining

Food 5 stars. 

Birthday song 0 stars.. 
wish they didn't constantly play this birthday song so much, it's super annoying..
Service was horribly slow and not very friendly.... Would NOT suggest eating here.. 50 minutes and still not cooking and no refil!

Good time here at this location. The service, the food and the decor are all great. The only drawback is that the main door to the men and women's restroom (not the door to the restroom itself) is located right next to one of the hibachi stations.

One other bit of information. When you the chef is cooking all the food, listen to what other people are requesting to be done to the food. For example, someone requested well seasoned food, but you don't want well seasoned. Make sure the chef understands that request of both of you.
Love this place I hade the salmon and it was outstanding! California rolls are a must try as well great place to bring friends and family

Our little girls (6 and 8) love hibachi. It is their favorite dinner request. We eat sushi or hibachi at least once or twice a month so we were excited when we heard about Ohjah. The atmosphere is fun and exciting. The staff is extremely attentive and quick with any request. I would recommend this restaurant just for the service. 

Now on to the food. All of us ordered the hibachi with the starter (soup and salad). It was delicious. The girls offered off the kids menu and we ordered off the adult menu. The portions and price are perfect for our family. Reasonable for the amount of fun that we had and the food was delicious. 

The girls already asked to have their birthday celebration here. The staff does a little something special for the birthday boy or girl. We witnessed 4 birthdays during our dining experience. Fun times!
Love love love this place!! The food is so good and it's so affordable you just can't beat it!! It's a perfect place for celebrations or dates!  My family and I go often!

I've been here twice and both times I have really enjoyed coming. Like a lot of Japanese restaurants there's one side for hibachi and the other for regular tables. Ohjah is always pretty busy but the service is fast and the food is consistently good. 

I order the chicken teriyaki appetizer and a side of fried rice. The portions are pretty good size but the fried rice didn't have as much egg as it should have. The sushi here is good and I don't even eat seafood! My friend shared her crunchy shrimp roll called rock n roll, and I just picked out the shrimp. The waitress we had was very nice without overly checking on our table. Some servers check on you every time your mouth is full, so I appreciate the ones who give me my space. 
I'll keep coming back here when I'm in the mood for great food & sake bombs.

Dynamite roll is just that-dynamite!
The Sushi was off the charts delicious and the service was terrific also.
I was also happy to see that Hibachi dining was available which is always a plus when you've got kids (I don't, but my friends do).
I've been here twice-once at the Sushi Bar and once at the Hibachi table; both offered great food, good service and a reason to come back.

I can only speak for the hibachi side. I LOVED IT. We each ordered the combination with filet mignon, shrimp, scallop and calamari. My boyfriend had the fried rice and I had the fried noodle (chow mein).  I would just like to say it was so delicious and melts on your mouth!  We loved our chef and our food, but whilst eating dinner a check gets dropped off then 5 minutes later the manager checked if we paid.

 Although I understand that maybe as hibachi tables stand, there's another group of people coming in, we still felt rushed and needed to get out. We were there to celebrate and to drink with really great food, but we were cut short. I hate feeling like we're being rushed out, especially when dessert wasn't offered. Because we felt like we needed to clear out, we didn't even get to look at the dessert menu again, and I wanted dessert! I mean, we were celebrating. We would've ordered another round of drinks with dessert, but wasn't given the chance and that is the only complaint.

There's a teppanyaki area and a regular dining area to eat sushi, Thai dishes, and other non-teppanyaki Japanese dinner entrees. I usually go to the teppanyaki side where you start with a basic hibachi entree which includes onion soup, house salad with ginger dressing, rice (brown, fried, or steamed) OR fried noodles, and veggies (carrots, onions, broccoli, and zucchini) for $8.95. The house salad with ginger dressing is good but the onion soup is a little bland and boring. Then you pick your choice of meat. I went with the NY steak (5 oz) for an additional $7.95. My steak was cooked perfectly. You also get two dipping sauces. The brown sauce is for the meat and the yellow sauce is for your vegetables. The prices are reasonable compared to overpriced Benihana.

No issues with service from the several times that I have went. I would only come here for the teppanyaki. I ordered the Ohjah Boat (rolls, sushi, and sashimi served on a wooden boat) on a previous visit. The sushi was meh and a bit on the warm side so I will just stick to the teppanyaki here. This is pretty much Benihana's but a lot cheaper where the chefs do their show with the flaming onion volcano, throw an egg in the chef's hat and split it with a spatula trick, & the chef throwing shrimp in your mouth act, etc. I'm not coordinated when it comes to that so I always decline politely. There are a lot of families with kids who like to come here so if you're one of those diners who hate kids, stay away or if you have kids, they would probably enjoy dinner with a show.

The last time we ate at Ojhah in Las Vegas was in 2014.  They impressed us so much that we came to try their Hibachi this time.  TIP:  Apparently you need reservations for the Hibachi.  We didn't have any so we had to wait 30 minutes.  Luckily there is a drug store next door you can pass the time in.  We were seated with a lovely family of 6.  All together there were 4 kids under 10 years old, our 2 teens (14 & 16 years old) and 4 parents.  The other Hibachi got the more enthusiastic chef.  Ours was just meh.  The fried rice made via Hibachi is always good but the meat (chicken) was kind of dry and tasteless.  I guess that's why they give you sauce.  What they did not give me was my free sake for checking in via Yelp.  I did order a salmon skin hand roll which was excellent.  I think they do better with their sushi than their Hibachi.  I'd probably return for their sushi, but I was not at all impressed with the Hibachi.

This place rocks! I stumbled to this location because I was buying some liquor from Lee's which is just next door. So I decided. To come back.

The ambiance is great! I actually would rate this as a great place to bring someone on a first date! The lights are dimmed at the restaurant area and the hibachi side was full of energy. They serve sushi and other Asian dishes. 

The hibachi is my favorite area.  What's good about it is that you can still order from items from the menu. The chefs are very entertaining.  They joke around with your table and do all the fancy tricks such as making the volcano onion, making the shrimp bunny, etc.  

The food is cooked exactly the way your ordered it.  It's very tasteful and the sauce they provide work perfectly with the items you order (fish vs meat vs chicken).  

Don't forget to check in because you get a free small sake bottle which was awesome! 

The price is very decent compared to other places such as Benihana.  It's about 40% less than the other hibachi restaurants.  

I ordered there house combo which was to pick any 3 items for your dish.  It was a surprise that the filet mignon was able to be part of your 3 items.  

The staff are super friendly and never has disappointed me.  I've been going at least 1 once month to treat myself and family.

This place is awesome! Stop reading and just go and experience it for yourself!!!

One of the top meals I've ever eaten!

Along with outstandingly fresh sushi, authentic yakisoba, perfect vegetable tempura, and melt-in-your-mouth mochi, the service there was the absolute best I've ever experienced. I don't write many reviews but felt this place needed my mentioning. 

Normally I research my restaurant options but yesterday we were starving and happened on this place so decided to chance it. 

As soon as we walked in the door the staff rushed to greet us and then got down on the kids level and talked to them for a minute. Awesome! They were also very helpful and patient with our many questions about menu items and didn't seem irritated by our indecisivness. 

We made our order and our rainbow roll was on the table within, not kidding, 3 minutes and was so SO fresh. As each dish was brought out and tasted, I was increasingly impressed. I wayyy overdid it on eating but the food was so worth it. The staff was very attentive and observant and when one of my girls started crying, they brought her over a small candy and talked to her. 

They were very polite and rushed to the door to bid us goodbye as well. 

We will be back for sure.

A friend took me to dinner to this new place ,just open about  few month.
So far, the 1st impression that it gave me was expensive dinning,but after my dinning experience I realized that I was totally wrong. 
It was by for the best Dianne I EVEN HAD.very reasonable price for an excellent quality of food and service. I think that's why the parking lot is always packed~!!!
I'd recommend make reservation B4 you come spcielly on weekends(sushi chef told me)
I set at the bar coz the hibachi was full~(it was an hour wait time on that side) we tried the sushi.The fish was super fresh ,Chef was friendly and funny at some point.If they have a little of time they even make some special dishes not listed on the menu and I got the wahoo, so yum~!!
The manager was keep asking us how's everything and told us about hibachi,such a nice and funny guy~
I'm coming back next time to try the hibachi table,seems that is really good.no regrets, I had a wonderful sushi and enforgettable dinning experience!!!!

This is my new favorite restaurant! The food is incredible. They seriously know what they are doing here. Everything is cooked to perfection and they plate beautifully- even the TO GO BOX was plated with care and finesse. I appreciate that level of detail. I have eaten hibachi in and gotten food to go and every time is great. Salmon Teriyaki is divine. The veggies are perfect and even the soup broth is amazing, deep rich flavor. Hibachi is really fun and would be a great place to take a group. Prices are so reasonable for what you get. The interior is really cozy & romantic even though you can't tell from outside.  Just go- GO!

Amazing! I've been here many times with my friends. They always keep up with their standards. Their sashimi is fresh no matter what time I go. Their servers are attentive and are always ready to serve you. My fiends love going here and even bring their kids. I would recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a good place to eat!
bomb..bomb.. .always great food, funny chefs, one of my favorite spots..i always get 3 item filet, shimp, and scallops..yumm..

We still love it here. We still ask for Van at Hibachi. Last night, we were starving at 7pm. Van wasn't available until 7:30. Although my I was ready to take any other chef, my kids all voted against me and said we should just wait for Van lol. We waited and finally ate a little after 8pm. Food was still amazing!

I'm crazy about hibachi lol.  This was our first experience at a hibachi grill, out chef was perfect he was funny and experience he delivered a great show and had us very entertained. Food was great to, I loved the salmon which I normally don't like, the chow main was delicious and those veggies cooked perfectly. Also the restaurant has a great atmosphere, it's very clean and roomie.
Cook is awesome so is the food however the waiter was a joke!!! I am a regular every 3 weeks but after that customers service I will no lo get be a regular amazing! !

We were seated very quickly and a server was there to take our order.   We did the 3 rolls special.   The summer breeze roll was one of my choices.   That was the lightest and best tasting roll I've had.  That's ideal for a quick lunch or a light dinner.  Very refreshing!  Definitely a will go back and I highly recommend trying that roll.    All the sushi is very fresh and great.
This used to be my favorite restaurant. Still pretty good but I miss there lunch time specials.

So delicious and amazing prices! Half the price of Geisha House.
The music is extremely soothing. Love the place and will go back often.
Not impressed with this place.  Chicken is way over cooked, wait staff doesn't know the menu, and the prices seem a bit hi for the quality..  Not a fan at all..

Ordered sashimi salad, teriyaki chicken, roll and kimchi soup.
Sashimi smelled like fish even with strong sauce, teriyaki chicken meat was dry, the rice inside roll had old smell.
Also waitress we had was no smile with princess attitude.
Overall,would not recommend to go there!
Last night was my 2nd time there and once again the food and the atmosphere was amazing. The two chefs I've had we're phenomenal and hilarious. Would definitely recommend this to friends.

This is the closest hibachi to my house and I love it! I went here back in February for my birthday and the portions are excellent and the chef did his normal routine of crazy knife flipping, shrimp tossing and creating volcanoes out of a stack of onions and oil. 

I also like the regular restaurant area because the regular rolls are decent. the sesame dressing in their house salad in phenomenal (a small detail I look for in Japanese/hibachi restaurants), the baked mussels are tasty and I loved the size of the glass when I ordered an oyster shooter. Surprisingly I also liked the portion of the pad Thai they serve here (yes, they have Thai on the menu at this place). I don't believe they do AYCE but it's still not a bad establishment to go to once every other month.

We LOVE hibachi and this is so conveniently close to home for us! Good service, good food, good drinks I would totally recommend this spot for their hibachi. I have yet to try their sushi but I am interested in going to that side of the restaurant to test it out soon! OH! And they give LVAC discounts woohoo :-)
Glad we tried this place, and it's right in our 'hood! Calamari tempura and filet mignon hibachi we're excellent!

I brought my cousins that were visiting from California to this location. The prices were incredible and the food was great!! However, the service for the Hibachi grill was a little slow because they couldn't get our grill to heat up. We were sitting there for a good 20 mins before our server explained to us what was going on. Luckily...the food made up for the delay and I will definitely come back to give them another try.
Delicious food! Highly recommend the chef special with the three rolls! The Japanese lasagna roll is amazing as well as Drago and kamikaze!

I like coming here for their Sashimi. I'm so used to AYCE sushi that I compare it to Ohjah. So i only come when I crave Sashimi.Yum! They have Hibachi which I don't care for so the dining area is less busy.

This was our first time here--the manager was amazing making sure that everything was taken care of because we needed to eat gluten free.  The cook also was attentive in that respect so that we were assured that everything would be cooked the way we requested it.  Our waiter was equally wonderful.  Service was obviously excellent and the food was really top shelf---without a doubt the best Hibachi dinner we've had.  Great wine selection--great atmosphere----all in all a wonderful dining experience!

First time finally trying this place out and I regret not coming here sooner, I'm so impressed! We ordered Beef Negimaki for our appetizer which was incredibly tender and full of flavor. I would come back just for this alone. I ordered the hibachi noodles with Filet mignon, which I was please to surprised it included the hibachi veggies, and salad and soup. Soup was so-so but the salad... Wow so simple yet so wonderful, something about the dressing you can't find anywhere else. My steak was cooked medium TO PERFECTION! I've been to fine dining steak houses that weren't as good and tender as this! My husband orders the fried rice (which I kept steeling, the scallops, and the chicken. The chicken was probably my least favorite, flavorful but a tad over cooked... I'll stick to my filet mignon. Great place to bring out of town guests, This place is great for birthdays too. We will be back!
The chef's are great the food is great and you can't beat the price.  There's nothing like having your food cooked in front of you and prepared the way you want it.  I love this place

My family and I love this place. We usually sit in the hibachi grill. I think over time we've ordered everything on the hibachi menu and I have never once been disappointed. The restaurant is always full and it's definitely because the food is good and the hibachi chef's are very funny and definitely give you a good show. The price is extremely reasonable and the service is phenomenal. Try the salmon, it's amazing.

Had gone many times with my children and had pleasant experiences. Even plugged them on Facebook videos and all. However last week we decided to go a little early for dinner around four for hibachi and it was empty we were literally the only ones there we asked to sit facing the grill not on the side because my kids get excited to catch the food in there mouth. The lady seating us told us no there may be another party coming in and she would have to move us. I couldn't believe it  there was literally no one else there and even if there was that was just rude. She also took the liberty of taking my cocktail menu. I decided to leave before we ordered it was obvious they were not interested in happy customers this day at least not us. I don't think we will be patronizing them again Luckily Vegas has a lot more options.

This is one of our favorite places!  The atmosphere is casual and there is a wide variety of items to choose from.   Kid friendly as well as a great place for an adult dinner. The prices are very reasonable and you get plenty of food.  The seafood is as good as their steak and I highly recommend this restaurant and location!

This place lives up to the hype!!  Excellent, really fresh food.  Great service and super reasonable.  Not like the overpriced hibachi restaurants near and on the strip. My family and I will be regulars for sure!

Staff is beyond friendly, everyone will thank you - all smiles.  This is my 2nd time eating here: salad and entree was delish, however the soup was pretty much water. The 4 in our group sent it back; we agreed it was like watered down canned broth. It was all liquid and some wonton strips... No scallions or mushrooms. Three filets were ordered and cooked perfectly, I ordered salmon which was a bit dry but I used a dipping sauce which satisfied my taste buds. Serving portion is huge - no need to order any appetizers if choosing hibachi. We also ordered a bottle of Fuji apple sake, only 8% alcohol so it's very weak.  You need to like apple juice because it tastes exactly the same and just as sweet.

This is our favorite Japanese Hibachi Grill and Restaurant in Vegas. We found it by accident a few years ago and come here for lunch or dinner every time we are in town. They never disappoint. Today was the first time we couldn't get seating at the grill without waiting an hour so we decided to stay and try the regular menu. Again, they didn't disappoint. The waitress kept apologize for the wait (they got slammed all at once) but it really didn't feel like a long wait. We had the chicken teriyaki and filet minion teriyaki.  Absolutely delicious!!

Went for the first time and did the hibachi and it was amazing! I'm a really picky eater and thought it was soooo good! The onion soup is so yummy and so was the fried rice, chicken teriyaki, and filet minion! Delicious!! Definitely recommend (even if you don't eat sushi like myself)

Stopped in for a family Valentines Dinner. We had dinner at the hibachi grill additionally we ordered a sushi roll, the pink lady. So very good. Service received from all was excellent. We were in and out in an hour. Not that we were in a hurry, we were just hungry! My new fav Vegas restaurant

I'm a first time sushi eater and all the things I heard about sushi joints is that they smell like fish and are a bit dodgy. This place smelled great and it was very clean. Next, went to the bathroom to check the cleanliness - spotless! 

Then the staff was so friendly. From the way they spoke to you to the way they cleared our table, great service. 

You gotta see MANDY! She was so patient, understanding and funny. She made me ver comfortable for my first time. I will come back again. I went to "I Love Sushi" and I didn't enjoy my experience there and so I haven't been back to a sushi place in years because I didn't enjoy my experience - until today! 

Come to this place and bring your friends!
Always dependable & friendly service,quality food with reasonable prices. It's our go to restaurant when  friends & family visit. Thank you for being consistent. That's rare in this city

I didn't get the young lady's name the last time I was here but I saw her today and had to shout her out!  Her name is Alice and she is really friendly.

I pretty much got the same thing except this time I asked for extra garlic for the fried rice and veggies.  The vegetables were cooked just right--flavorful and delicious.  

Maybe it was my driving, maybe not, but half of the rolls came apart by the time I got home but that didn't affect the taste one bit :)

If you are vegan be sure to ask for the ginger dressing with the salad.  I forgot this time and ended up with the mayo-based dressing.  

Still good service.  Didn't have to wait long.

Picture this - Sea World and the dolphins are doing funny things to the sound of a whistle. Now flash forward to this eatery - minus the dolphins...it is the same thing. A group of people are seated around a grill in which the "trainer" or chef makes noises with utensils and then flips food into mouths of the people that pay $30 each to be treated like a sea lion and clap after being tossed a piece of shrimp. 

Excitement level - crazy weird. Not my thing, I would rather head to the real Sea World and laugh at the goofy dolphins and sea lions doing tricks for food than the Vegas elite...

Decent food though...

Didn't get five because we come here weekly but it doesn't feel like we are appreciated!

The food is great and service pretty good.

The poke is what we get every time but now it's less and less poke!

They need to treat repeated customers better

I love this place! It's down the street from the house and the prices are very reasonable. We almost always do the hibachi every time. Can go wrong with this place. Service is usually on point as well.
Delicious food! Love the Hibachi... always fun. Great service, great food, decent prices!

Good Prices, Okay Dishes, Excellent Service

In terms of the food, the sushi dishes were somewhat tasty, but an overall fail compared to some of Ohjah's competitors.  I ordered a variety of sushi dishes.  I enjoyed the rolls, but just found that the execution didn't match Soho (or Nobu - but that's fair) for the yellowtail jalapeno dish.  As to the short ribs, they were essentially Korean galbi, which were bland and tough.  I would definitely not order that dish again, although I would go back to try the other dishes because the price point and service were good.

Great food, love he a la carte options for hibachi. Sushi is good. Chefs have a few tricks and food is always cooked correctly. Friendly staff make an enjoyable dining experience. Must say that the salad dressing is wonderful. The quality of the ingredients is very good. I wish the chefs would make more sauces to go with your food.

Customer service was very good.  The staff is super friendly - almost too friendly.  Every time someone passed our table, they would ask how everything is and then thank us.  Each one probably asked us 3x during our meal.  Never had to wave them down, because they frequently ask if we need anything.  They also say thank you when they bring your food, refill your drink, bring the check, etc.

The food itself was okay.  The salad dressing was refreshing, and the soup was flavorful.  I really liked the "nachos", which were two deep-fried wonton wrappers with imitation crab and avocado on top. 

The cucumber salad was too salty,  the fried calamari was bland and the sauce it came with tasted like it was watered down.  The sukiyaki was good, but a little too sweet.  I ended up using the cucumbers as a condiment and put slices on top of everything to balance out the flavors.
Great service! They were able to do hibachi gluten free for me and followed all the proper etiquette, which is always nice to see and not have to ask for. Food was great!
I arrived an hour before closing and the service was EXCELLENT. The food is superb if you are in Las Vegas you must stop by.
Not bad for a new restaurant! Steak teriyaki portion was pretty generous.
Want great sushi? Eat here. The presentation and service are great and their prices are reasonable. I love this place!
We try to go to this restaurant about every other month.  Everything is wonderful - food, service, atmosphere and the show they put on the Hibachi grill in front of you.  Keep up the good work.

The serving sizes are huge. The servers are very  professional. We order the hibachi special for $31.95 which allows us to choose three meat items. I had the filet minon , Scallops and shrimp. Pricier items can be picked for an additional cost (Kobe beef, lobster...)

The place is clean and neat.  Each chef table can accommodate 12 guests.  
The flavor of the food was average. The place is getting 4 stars from me because chef didn't seem to have the patience to entertain our toddler kids. Our only reason to eat at the place was so the kids can have a little fun. It looked to me like our chef would have spent more time if the guests were grown ups. I can tell that he has a "R" rated sense of humor. 

Overall - the place offers good value.

My fiancée and I went in on a whim tonight for the hibachi side. It's pretty roomy inside and we got to a table where four friends were already at. Not too crowded, nice. The waitress came over right away, Fiona I believe, and she was very nice, attentive, and friendly. We never waited for anything. The chef came and he was AMAZING, older gentleman, Devon or David we believe we heard his name was, had 30 years under his belt and his skill showed that yet he still acted like it was just as fun as day 2. So funny and jokes were everywhere, such a good time. The manager was incredibly nice as well having come over to check on us after we were served food. 

Really, no complaints. However, it is very different from other hibachi places we've been, taste wise. Different, not bad. And the prices were awesome, $40 for just the two of us. We'll definitely be back.

Great food, great service.  

The staff is fantastic -- they remember you and what you like.  I've come to the point where I usually dont even bother looking at the menu.  I just tell them "Surprise me"

Although it does not look "kid friendly," they are extremely so.  We bring our 3 year old and 1 year old in all the time, and the kids destroy the place (sorry!).  They are always accommodating and friendly about it, and I can say that I would not have such patience if I were them.  

Of course, we also go here for business lunches all the time -- this is my place of choice for business lunches.

Worst teppan I've ever had. We had the older gentleman cooking our food. The stove was too hot and he was slow. He burned it all. vegetables were horrible burnt and mushy. The fried rice was over cooked and chewy. The chicken was extremely over done and chewy. I have never had crispy salmon before but it was alright. The steak was the only thing that was cooked right. I will never go here again for Teppan. Very disappointed since it had such high reviews.

Hands down best hibachi in Vegas that isn't on the strip. Prices are very affordable with large portions. Cuts of steak and veggies were fresh and the staff including the owner were extremely attentive and accommodating. Will return here again when back in LV!

This has been my spot for years. They are so friendly. The food is super good, they cook it in front of you. And the sushi is to die for. And an amazing variety of sake. Try this place out. It's great, and not to expensive.

Ohjah! Ohjah! What another great dining experience Hibachi style!! I had some friends from the east coast come out to Las Vegas to celebrate a birthday and in the midst of planning everything else I suggested this place because she loves the whole Hibachi teppanyaki thing. Now normally people are quick to turn to Benihana's when they think Hibachi however I just prefer to think outside of the box and not run to what everybody else likes. They are a bit overrated in my opinion but that's neither here nor there. Back to Ohjah..

Reservations were easy as pie to make and the young lady who assisted with the request was very pleasant to work with. We informed them ahead of time that this party of 7 would be celebrating a special occasion which was for the birthday girl! We were a bit late and called them to let them know and still are reservation was held and we began the festivities of what Ohjah has to offer. I really love that they keep things super traditional and at the bar they offer only whatever special drinks they concoct, sake hot/cold and wines both red and white!

Our chef was pretty damn awesome with plenty energy he performed many tricks to impress. The chefs attitude usually can make or break your whole experience at these type of restaurants so it's imperative that you luck up on getting one who truly enjoys the job.  The fact that they went above and beyond to make sure my friends birthday dinner was perfect was absolutely appreciated! The food here was great and I personally enjoyed my Shrimp and fried rice! I will be returning soon!

The food is great but the service as usual sucks the owner stopped us Rightaway and said for us to sit at the table and did not want to let us sit at the Hamachi table because there was an enough people had one table. (There was six of us)
Sit at the sushi bar you get the best service from the chefs in the back.

LOVE Ohjah. Staff is extraordinary and chefs amazing. We come here as often as we can to take advantage of the deliciousness. The wait staff even recognizes my 4-year-old daughter whenever we are here, which makes her experience even better.
This is the best hibachi place!!! It is totally reasonable in price! Awesome food, great service-drink never went empty! We are totally coming back!!!

Currently at ohjah. My girlfriend and j have been waiting 50 minutes and barely ordered 10 minutes ago. Food was good but wait was terrible. Probably Would revisit 


Edit:the owner got back to me and that is very professional on his part! Due to this I will change my rating and I will continue to be a customer. Hopefully it's just a little faster next time

I would recommend the garlic edemame, shrimp tempanaki, and the shrimp tempura, best parts of my meal.

Overall we had a good experience- the hibachi experience was fun and the food was great for the price! However, we did feel like they were rushing us out and it wasn't even that crowded! Before our whole table was seated we had already been served soup and salad. The poor people next to us seated after had to eat all the appetizers while eating their dinner! During the hibachi cooking they brought us our check so we were unable to order anything additional and as soon as we finished our plates they were ready to walk us to the door.

Will probably be back at some point, but will be trying some other places around the area as well!

We dined here last night, one our favorite places for a large group. Van, the hibachi chef is our favorite. We always request him, unfortunately there was a mix up and we got a different chef, Terry. Terry was amazing as well, his friend rice flipping was extremely impressive! Van even came over to acknowledge the mix up and say hi. To me that made the whole experience for our group. Great food, great service, great prices!

Honestly best sushi restaurant in the Southwest area. Every time I come here I get quality sushi: delicious hand rolls, rolls, and sashimi. The staff have great customer service too!!! I've been to sushi restaurants around Chinatown where the restaurant staff were meh. I really recommend trying this restaurant if you're around the area.

Excited and drove far out because it's opening 5 minutes by our house. Expectations weren't met:( so sad about about it. Fried rice lacks flavor does not compare to Hokkaido, Hamada, Benihana and Hikari. Do not order halibut, came with 5 bones:(((... And chef over cooked:( concept of add on good but failed to execute and quite pricey after all. Service not great but not worth coming back.

This is the second time I have tried this place and it's horrible....... The rolls have no sauce in them and when u ask for side sauce they are stingy about it. My " garlic edemame was so dry with no garlic flavor at all....when I told the waitress she laughed and walked away to get the manager .... He cooked up a new one with " more garlic and sauce" and it came back burnt to a crisp tasting like burn..... She was super rude most of all. And not to mention the sushi here is super super bland !!!!! NEVER COMMING HERE AGAIN ....sushi fever is the BEST this place is a piece of shit

This is our third time here but first time trying their teppanyaki. The a la carte menu has pretty good items including sushi rolls. Before tonight this was just a safe place to try decent Japanese near our home. Having the teppanyaki was the best decision! The cook also puts on a show, like the flaming onion ring volcano plus he launches shrimp from the grill into the patrons mouths. Now on to the food... we got the sukiyaki beef and NY steak (both prepared medium) as well as scallops, shrimp and salmon. For group of five, we just got 2 orders each of the above to share and it proved plenty. Totally loved everything we were served! I finished it all but the rest of the family had to get take out boxes. Also included were a cup of onion soup, salad with ginger dressing and grilled vegetables, which was also pretty good. The service is excellent! We'll definitely be back.

For "out of towners" this was an absolute treat!  Easy to find, great parking, great food, price and service!  Our kids had a blast as well. We enjoyed the bonsai dinner which had plenty of sushi for two. The price was unbeatable. Wish we had a place like this close to home. If you're not sure, go!
Well worth the money and a delicious dinner to boot.

Another quality meal from the team behind Ohjah. This is my second time at the restaurant and first at this location and the meal lived up to my prior recollections. Great service, lively cook, and a fun time all around. This time I went with the NY Strip and tried some filet from the person I dined with. This is actually very quality meat considering the price. Cooked exactly how I asked (medium rare) and seasoned tremendously. I am a true fan of the Ohjah experience.  For about $20 each you can really experience a hibachi themed meal here.
Teppanyaki grill is like sex... Even when it's bad, it's still good! Haha. Good food, pretty good service and was cheaper than most teppanyaki spots.

So it started off wrong...When we entered the Manager proceeded to tell us he would have a table for us in about 15 minutes and that the people are leaving but they keep talking and talking like they were getting on his nerves. OK! who tells that to customers? That's exactly what we plan to do (we had a party of four) we intended on enjoying the evening with dinner and drinks. Hellllo!! once we got to the table the plates were dirty we had to get them switched out. We order drinks and again my glass was extremely dirty. I ordered a long island ice tea but really it was a lemonade with a shot of rum WTF. So I got a new drink, this time it was a coke and rum. I just came to the conclusion that the bartender didn't know what the hell he was doing. I was tired of complaining and ordering the same drink with no results. I hope they get it together. The waitress was nice and patient and I understood that it was not her fault. The chef saved the day because he was fun and a great cook.

Dropped in with crew after a race. We were tired  hungry and 4 hours from home which generally makes me hard to please. "Sushi" was better than expected, we did not try rolls. Food was above a 4 but below a 5. All staff was a 4 with the exception of our chef who was a 7, and we do a lot of tepan so the gimmick stuff is lost on me by now, he was different and excellent. 
Rating on a overall 1.5hr experience, not picking it apart.
I recommend this restaurant if you have time to sit down an enjoy good Japanese food..! It is just a great atmosphere and they take the time to prepare it very well...! Top Notch!

I've been to several tepinyaki places and there is nothing that stands out about this place so much. Everything is al a carte which kinda threw me off at first, but actually it works out for me. I don't eat the veggies and soup so I'm just interested in the fried rice and meat. It was good, but not the best I've had. The service was great though.

Get the boat.  Seriously.  Get the boat. 

I cannot push this more unless I were to kidnap you and take you to the restaurant and forcefeed you sushi.  And that's just wrong, and requires way too much effort. 

So get the boat. 

It's a platter (shaped like a ship) with all sorts of nom-nom-nom nigiri, sashimi, and your choice of three specialty rolls.  So, so good.  This is a shared plate, and you need at least two people (who are especially hungry) or, more wisely, four people.  

I am a fan of the caterpillar roll, so inevitably this was one of my choices.  Tender eel, firm avocado, nicely packed rice, and tasty sauce - nom.  

The service here was great too!  The server was a pleasant woman who was always ready with water refills (why ruin the tastiness of sushi with a competing flavor from soda?), and the sushi chef was ready to answer questions. 

Oh yeah, bathrooms were spotless! 

I will have to go back and investigate the hibachi side of the restaurant at a later date, as this review is only about the sushi. 

But yeah, get the boat.

We decided to try this place for my husband birthday. We are so happy for our experience. I ask for scallops it was so good! Shrimp are huge! They give you free dessert for birthday! Definitely will coming back! Highly recommended this place!!!
Very good sushi,  no complaints...well I guess the birthday announcements are annoying.

This was my first experience at a Hibachi restaurant. Loved it, super good. You get a salad and soup with your meal and it's perfect. 
Chef Ken was our chef he was fun and very nice. 
My only tiny complaint was that I should have ordered another protein, the amount of shrimp you get isn't a lot. 

If you check in here you get a free small sake too which is a cool thing for this place to do.

By the far the cheapest tappenyaki/hibachi around town. You can seriously get by dinner here for $15 while other places charge $50-80 per plate. Ridiculous!! I was really surprised when I saw the menu on how cheap it was. Especially with the great quality of the food here.

I can only rate on the hibachi section (where they cook your food in front of you) since that's the only part I've experienced. You first start out with a small soup and salad. Veggies are already included in your cooked meal. You choose between fried rice and fried noodle (basically chow mein). Then you pick your meat. They have a pretty good range including chicken, NY steam, filet minion, shrimp, calamari, kobe, etc. They really slab a lot of the food with butter, but I assume that's why it all taste so good.

Chefs are very entertaining. They do all sorts of tricks with their knives and try to entertain you with the food. 

The only reason why I am taking off one star is because I encountered 1 chef that was a bit rude. Usually when I come here, all the chefs are pleasant and funny. Recently when I came, the chef asked how I like my steak cooked. So I said "well done." He gave me a nasty look and said "really? Why bother get filet minion then?" It caught me off guard as he came off like that. In my head, I thought why does it matter? He should of just cooked it the way I requested. I felt like he was complaining because he was impatient and didn't wanna keep standing there just to cook mine. It shouldn't matter how one likes their steak...just cook it. I wanted to complain to the manager, but I didn't wanna make that big of a deal of it. 

So I'm sorry if you encounter a douchebag chef, but most of them are really nice. Just hope it doesn't offset or ruin your night. 

Praying that y'all get a decent chef next time. ~

The first time I ate here we did the hibachi which is a lot of fun...especially if you have a big group or kids with you.

Tonight I went for sushi and it was really good. The spider roll had crab meat in it and of course that paired perfectly with the soft shelled crab, but I've never had it prepared that way.

The highlight was a sushi rolled called "Captain" that was one of the more delightful rolls I've ever had. It had crispy fried onion rings on top of spicy tuna and some kind of garlic sauce. Serious yum and kudos to the sushi chef who came up with the idea!

I will definitely be back.

Thanks, Ohjah!
Great spicy ramen and gyoza. More seating in the restaurant than most ramen places and well staffed. Quick food with great quality.

It's so funny, that I couldn't remember eating here! It took me a bit to remember which is sad because I did enjoy the meal!
I came here with friends, Erika T and Aileen, after a day of shopping at Primm.
I ordered the tako (octopus) and it was delicious. The lobster roll tasted nice but it fell apart. (I think it was too drowned in sauce). The salad was ok, I prefer a ginger dressing that tastes like ginger.
The service was good, the prices are good too. I'll come back for sure, if I am in the area. It's alittle far from where I live for me to be a regular.

I don't think of hibachi places as big draws, especially for the foodie crowd. So, I was surprised to walk into Ohjah on a Friday night and see the place packed. It's also a sushi joint, but that side of the restaurant had a few open tables. The hibachi side was filled. That's impressive considering they had six cooking stations.

The basic hibachi dinner ($8.95) consists of standard fare -- vegetables, salad, soup, and fried or steamed rice or noodles. I added shrimp ($5.75) and a 5 oz. filet ($7.55) to the mix. The shrimp was pretty good and the filet was cooked medium rare, as ordered, and was tender, as expected.

The best way to judge any hibachi place, though, is the entertainment factor. Our chef -- an older guy -- was ok. He was friendly enough, but all the tricks he did were the same standard ones you see at any hibachi place -- tossing the egg shell in the hat, the onion volcano, etc. He also tossed shrimp to some of the guests (again, a standard hibachi trick) but only to the guys, which disappointed some of the women at the table.

If you like hibachi places, you'll like this. If you don't, you probably won't be a fan. While it's similar to many others I've been to, I'd recommend this place for a fun night out whether or not it's with a date or a family.

Love the atmosphere, love the staff and the chef who put on an adequate show with his cooking skills in front of the patrons.

For appetizers, ordered the seaweed salad which was on par with typical sushi spots.

Ordered the $48.95 dollar sushi boat + hibachi for our main entree. Presentation of the boat was good, except the sushi tasted just a-ok, nothing special compared to other sushi places we have gone to. The sashimi wasn't bad either, but didn't rise to the top. The tuna & salmon --- just okay.

The biggest upside is the hibachi. Having the chef cook in front of you never gets old to me. The hibachi basic + add-ons were all very tasty, although we noticed the cook did add A LOT of butter when he cooked.

Overall, you should have a good time here. But if you want better tasting sushi in Las Vegas, you're better off at Oyshi, Sushi Tower or Nobu (on the strip).

Today was their grand opening day and I couldn't have been any more excited! I pass by this place everyday and was anxious to try this new restaurant on Decatur and Blue Diamond. On my way home from work, I saw their "Open" sign lit up so I called my husband right away and told him to meet me there for dinner.

We were greeted warmly when we walked in and were asked if we wanted to sit at the bar, a booth or if we wanted hibachi. We opted for hibachi. The hibachi room was huge and there were eight cooking stations. 

My husband ordered the Special Rolls Combo for $23.95 and got the Dragon Roll, Spider Man Roll and Kamikaze. I ordered the Filet Mignon hibachi which came with vegetable teppanyaki, house salad, miso soup and your choice of fried rice, fried noodle or steamed rice for $16.50.

The sushi was pretty good... Normally my husband and I like raw fish but since I'm pregnant, he ordered all cooked rolls. I especially liked the Dragon Roll because the salmon was cooked with a nice charred taste. I think I may be used to AYCE sushi so I don't think I sushi would be my first choice when I come back.

I enjoyed my hibachi meal and our chef was entertaining. I watched three different hibachi chefs and it looked like they all had their own tricks up their sleeves. The house salad was good but they were a little too liberal with the dressing. I enjoyed the Filet Mignon very much because the meat was tender and flavorful and cooked to my preference.

I was too full to order dessert but I want to try the tempura ice cream next time. The only three dessert items are ice cream, mochi ice cream and tempura ice cream.

The service was top notch even though they had a lot of patrons. We were checked on regularly and we didn't have to wait long for our food or our check. The service was surprisingly good for a restaurant's opening day!  

I will be back again since this place is super close to home. I'm so glad this place that I have been keeping tabs on is finally open! Ohjah was definitely worth the wait!

I give this two stars because our experience was horrible. We were a table of 8. We all ordered together and the server brought my friends food when the rest of us were done! When approaching the manager he just said it's coming it's coming. Horrible experience and the sushi wasn't even that good either.

More like a 4.5 rating!
Second time back with a $20 off and ordered the right thing...ohjah boat!  It was definitely a winning boat.  We received 3 specialty rolls (our choice), 12 pcs of sashimi (4 salmon, 4 ahi tuna, and 4 hamachi, all were 1/2 inches thick, biggest slice of sahimi that I have seen), 10 pcs of nigiri, and a seaweed salad.  The fish was very fresh.  

We also had the lychee sake and I thought it was very refreshing, even for a non-drinker like myself.

Our waitress was very attentive and friendly.

Overall, I enjoyed it very much, and will definitely return to try the hibachi.

The food was good and our waitress was great. If that was all that happened they would have gotten 4 stars, but it wasn't. I was meeting my family for mom's bday dinner, and I thought I got there after everyone so I checked and they weren't there. My brother texted me that they made a reservation and they were like a couple minutes away. I tell the hostess we have a reservation under my brothers name. She tells me she seated them, which is weird seeing as how she told me I can walk and find them and came back and told her they were not there. I told her that no they are not seated and my party wasn't here yet. She preceded to tell me I was wrong as if I don't know wtf my family looks like. She raised her voice. It's not my fault you made a mistake. Luckily they weren't busy and sat us, but the whole experience was super frustrating. Also, the "reservation table" had the more experienced teppanyaki chef, which was a bummer... especially since it was my mom's bday, she would have enjoyed it a lot more. The chef we got was ok and he didn't seem too excited lol.
We've been here a few times now and it's a consistent 3 1/2 stars. It is an easy and comfortable environment for a sushi dinner with the family.

Ok, My wife is vegetarian now so our dining options are kinda limited ( I know there are options, but that knocks out ALL of my burger joints.. LOL)  So, we drive my Ohjah literally every day and wanted to try it out. We were very pleasantly surprised. The service was very good and the young lady that helped us was great. Even the owner ( or just a very official looking gentleman) came by our table. 

We didn't do the Teppan Yaki so we sat at a regular table. The atmosphere is very nice and the restaurant is very clean. We got some vegetarian sushi rolls ( avocado and Asparagus tempura) that my wife LOVED. I tried them and they were very good. I got a simple california Roll and it was great too. She got vegetarian Fried Rice that was very fresh tasting with crisp sautéed vegetables. It was great. I got the New York Steak Teriyaki. It was good. We even got dessert ( Mochi and tempura Ice Cream).

Its very nice to have a good dining establishment in the Neighborhood. We will frequent Ohjah often.

SERIOUSLY great service. The hibachi space has adequate seating so you don't feel cramped. Plus I got free saki just for yelping.

The hostess was really nice. When I showed her my YELP check in, I think she got just as excited as I was. With the press of a button *poof* just like that free hot saki. 

The chefs are great here. They are not just entertaining but they have a certain swagger when rocking those knives and spices. The entertainment factor alone made the night cool. The food was super good. All of the other reviews are 100% accurate. Everything just melts in your mouth. I was a little hesitant about getting the shrimp because previous reviews said it tasted too fishy or something like that. Im not sure if they made some changes or what, but it tasted fine to me. The 5 star factor here are the employees. We went here to celebrate a birthday and they made it really special. It wasn't just about the song or the dessert. They made the entire experience memorable. Ohjah ill definitely be back.

Food was ok. Sushi is expensive and ok is not really ok. Place was busy, really loud inside. My beef udon soup had a really odd sweet flavor to it, never did finish it. Food quality and quantity was good. Nice decor, clean restrooms. Parking sucked. The experience wasn't bad, there's other sushi places which I felt are better.

One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and its close by! The staff is really nice and excited to see my family and I every time we walk in.

The teriyaki salmon is my favorite from the lunch menu. I crave it and its greatly priced. Also the shrimp tempura, must get. 

I love taking friends from out of town to hibachi, they feel like we are really going all out at a fancy Vegas restaurant. I'm like a kid watching them cook in front of me. 

My mom tells me i need to stop telling people about her favorite restaurant. Lol :)

Enjoyed my meal, the food was great and the staff was friendly. Ordered two hibachis - shrimp and salmon - both were prepared well and quickly. Also ordered the gyoza which was great. I gave them 3 stars because I felt rushed the whole meal. Halfway through eating they presented us the bill. I wanted to order dessert but was kind of taken aback of how quickly they wanted us to leave. I noticed they were getting busier and seats were getting limited but I would have liked to relax a little more. Overall I was happy to find this place as they did have a good variety on the menu with reasonable prices, next time I will try a less busy time.

Oh, HELLOOOOOOO! Sail away with me...on their sushi boat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

3 kinds of sashimi (sake, maguro, Hamachi) x 4 kinds of nigiri x 3 specialty rolls.
We chose the Ohjah roll, Show Me the Love roll, and Cowboys roll. We tried to choose the most expensive rolls. OBVI. 

Just having a boat full of sushi come out to you is (almost) like love at 1st sight.
Especially when it's $40!

Oh man...great teppanyaki and at a great price! I came for dinner for Father's Day and tried out the teppanyaki. I love how they do their offerings. They separate the meats by section and individual price so that you can mix and match your plate however you want. I chose the NY strip steak and the shrimp. My sister tried the scallops and NY steak. MY father tried the sukiyaki beef and NY steak, and my brother in law tried the Salmon and chicken. 

You start with the $8.95 basics which includes the the option of fried rice, steamed rice, or noodles, soup, and salad. This is MANDATORY for teppanyaki. Then you pick from the list of meats you'd like and you just mix and match. They also offer kobe beef at $50 and lobster tail also at $15. The dishes and offerings are typically what you'd expect for teppanyaki. Same quality and flavor. Next time I would love to try the filet minon instead as I wasn't too fond of the NY strip steak. It was tougher and less flavoring. The sukiyaki beef is A GOOD CHOICE. They're full of flavor, tender, and juicy! 

Our chef was great, He was funny, and very patient with obnoxious children. So big ups to him. For a total of 4 people plus an order of a glass of reisling and tempura ice cream we spent a good $100.00. Woohoo! What a deal! That's compared to my tab at Musashi which was $160.00 for 2 people! Same quality of food. Same service. Cheaper price. Call me a fan! I'll be back soon!

I really love this place, and am sad I didn't know it existed until a couple of months ago. It's got everything going for it. The ambiance is beautiful, the waitstaff is friendly and eager to please, and the food it amazing. It's also very reasonably priced for the quality of food they offer. Ever since Nagoya closed down I've been looking for a good replacement. This place is even better than Nagoya in my opinion. I haven't tried the hibachi portion of this yet, I've only sat down for dinner but I'm willing to bet it's a positive experience.

Went here Feb 27th, 2016. It was awesome. My mom was out for a visit from Ohio and want to take my niece and I out for dinner. They have great prices, great service, & great entertainment. Food was so good. I will be back.

First timer & cannot wait to go back! Fresh sashimi, flavorful white tuna, addicting fried rice and a great selection of drinks! Was so incredibly full when I left, but now have been craving everything I had when I was there! Quiet, quaint, not very fancy, but fantastic and friendly service!

My love and I heard good things about other Ohjah locations so one night we decided to check out the newest location on Blue Diamond, close to our home. We love sushi and hibachi and have ate at many hibachi type restaurants in and out of Las Vegas. So I was excited and had high hopes of a new restaurant close to home. When we first arrived I noticed the interior, it's beautiful, classy and not the typical Japanese decor that so many other places in town aim for. We were seated and I immediately noticed not only the wonderful smell of others already enjoying their meals, but the menu. Every item is al a cart, reasonable and inexpensive. Considering that we have spent well over $100 at like restaurants in the past for a party of two, I was presently surprised and already liking this place. But let's be honest, if the food is crap.....the prices really are irrelevant right? 

So, we both ordered different meats to try more of the menu. Me chicken, he steak. The chef came out and was fantastically funny, sweet and incredibly skillful while cooking. It still blows my mind the cracking and throwing of eggs lol. Anyways, back to the food. It was great! The rice was fluffy, the vegetables were tasty and the meat was cooked to perfection. We have since ate here many times and we have never been let down, I have tried all of the meat/fish items on the hibachi menu and they're all equally delicious. Did I mention I don't think our bill has ever been over $60 including tip? I haven't tried the sushi because the hibachi is so very good it's hard to try something else, when we usually only go there because that's exactly what were craving. I recommend everyone check out Ohjah on Decatur and Blue Diamond.

I think this is my favorite place to get japanned food,  but ironically they have the best Thai Beef Curry I have ever eaten.  The staff is always very friendly and pleasant.  My daughter is like a the Cookie Monster when it comes to sushi and says it is bomb.  She is 14 hahahha.  I highly recommended the place for sushi Thai and hibachi style dining.

I wanted to like this place, the one time I went the food was good, price was great, and hibachi is always fun (however the service was terrible, the waitress didn't speak english, seemed miserable, and came by to refill our drinks MAYBE once.)  However, I thought it would be a neat place to have my bday and bring 7 of my friends.  The day of my bday I called and asked if I could make a reservation for 9 pm.  They told me no, the only time they could fit me in was 8 pm.  A little too early, but I make my friends rush and we get there at 8 pm on the dot.  The employee at the front was SO RUDE, said there was no way i made a reservation because he was working   the phone all day and I didn't call, and then DEMANDS to see my phone as proof that I  called and made a reservation.  After I show him my phone, he says "Was this today"... umm it clearly is timestamped saying today. Then he says "Well we have no room, you can come back at 9". WHAT?! that was the original time I wanted and you said I couldn't have!?!?  Needless to say, he totally ruined my bday!
This is definitely the best place in Vegas to get Teppanyaki my only wish is that they had white sauce to go with everything and it would be game over for everyone and their weight.

Our new sushi spot finally!!!! We the service was awesome and sushi was AMAZING!!! We sat at the bar and so glad we did, the chef made us different rolls and we loved them all! 

I can't wait to come back and bring my family & friends. I wish the drinks were a little stronger, sweetest long Island ever but I'm here to mainly eat not get drunk LOL

Some great Hibachi! 

Went with some dear friends for a celebrated event. Service was moderate (we waited quite a bit, but we were a party of 15+). Hibachi was pretty damn fine Hibachi. Meat portions on the metal grill were scant so definitely get two upgrades.

Glorious Oddity: The Thai Curry was the best Thai Curry I've ever had. Better than Pin Kaow. It was amazing. AMAZING.

The place is an excellent value.

I missed my hibachi back home and my fiance and I decided to try this one because it was close to the same prices.  

Wow...talk about an improvement.  The food was fantastic and I'm completely in love with the soup that comes with the hibachi meals.  The salads were good, I'm not a huge fan of the dressing but my fiance enjoyed it (it's the first time I've ever seen him devour a bowl of salad like it was the main course).  The fried rice was fantastic, as were the chicken and beef that we got.  The couple seated next to us had lobster and scallops and they both said they'd come back just to get those again.  

If I had to criticize anything, it would be that the veggies were a little bit too soft for my liking.  They didn't have as much flavor to them as the rest of the meal did.  

On the way out, we were told "Thank you, we hope to see you again" or some varient of at least six times.  Talk about feeling like a valued customer.

Unexpected dinner with out of town family, and I was very impressed with quality of food. We had two 'real' sushi eaters and two 'just need to be cooked' sushi eaters, and everyone was happy with their selections. Good service too, despite being busy, waitress always checked on us.

The prices might be deceiving but it's all worth it! The hibachi was awesome! I recommend getting the hibachi combination it comes with, salad, onion soup, rice or noodles, and 3 entrees for only $30! As an awesome bonus the chefs put on a show for you while they cook! This place is defiantly worth a visit.

Luckily we made reservations as the hibachi side was packed. We enjoyed the free check in item. I appreciated the ample staff and their service. Our chef wasn't as animated as some of my previous hibachi experiences but he was on point. The lobster was very good and the filet was perfectly cooked and very tasty. One of my kids decided against hibachi and there was plenty on the menu for her to choose. I would recommend them and will return.

I come here often for the Snow White sushi roll and garlic edamame.  I have also been on the hibachi side, and had the calamari, which was excellent.,  The food and price are very reasonable. Usually not a long wait for dining in, if any.  The only trouble I have ever had is when I order by phone for take out, there have been a couple times I called 20 minutes prior to arriving, and still had to wait another 15, even though they said it would be ready in 15 minutes from the time I called.  Not sure where the issue lies with that one.  Still, they are apologetic through the waiting process, but it has happened more than once.  On the other hand, no complaints about dining in.

The combination fried rice was amazing.....three roll combo for $25...all in all a really great meal for the price.  Rolls could be a little bigger, but the quality and taste makes up for it. The restaurant was clean and the staff friendly, although the service was a bit slow. Overall I really liked the place and will definately be back.

Great food. I eat here at least 1 or 2 or more a month. Do the hibachi. And also get to go food about the same amount of time a month. Hibachi side The chefs are amazing. Some are funnier than others. To go you always have amazing service.

Happy Mother's day to all!!!  (Dine in side) Ohjah has definitely been consistent with their establishments.  From their noodle house to their steakhouse both have exceptional service.  We started with appetizers chicken egg rolls, and tempura calamari.  Both were light, flakey, and freshly made.  Give it a couple minutes to cool down because it's that fresh.  

My main entree was a side of steam rice, and sashimi chief's choice (5 assorted).  The Chef's  choice was Albacore Tuna, Salmon, Tuna, Yellow tail, and Sea bass was all refreshingly delicious.  The assortments vary everyday, so get your sashimi  adventure taste buds on.  

Finally, I order their Green Tea Tempura ice cream enough to share between four people.  The deep fried tempura was excellent.  No too crispy, and not too doughy.  I can not wait to come back, and try their hibachi side.  From what I can tell the hibachi section is great, for couples, or a large group.  I am definitely looking forward to watching the chefs cook my food in front of me with their unique entertaining style.  Dine in section is recommend, for a nice conversation, and a more intimate experience.

Rated based on atmosphere, cleanliness, presentation, taste, and overall satisfaction.

Awesome, our family loves coming here. Our 2 year old enjoys the little show they put on and he eats well every time! They were very accommodating with my infant in the car seat. The fried rice is so yummy. Sashimi is awesome! 

Minus 1 star because every time we come the server/host(ess) seems to always rush us in ordering our food. I understand there are other families in the group and of course we don't want to keep them waiting but both times, the others have barely ordered their appetizers and with two littles ones..we have to get ourselves situated and be able to read the menu while fighting with usual "kid" stuff at the table. This time, it seemed like she was already frustrated that we needed 5 minutes to decide what we wanted. 

Anyway, we ordered 2 hibachi dinners, one with NY Steak & the other with Teriyaki Chicken, a Rainbow Roll, Calamari, 2 orders of Tuna Sashimi, a large Sapporo beer, and Apple juice = ~$90 with tip. Not bad - will definitely come again.

We came on a cold Friday evening so it wasn't too crowded, and we enjoyed having elbow room on the counter. 

We ordered the basic with the NY steak and shared a lobster roll which was amazing!

It was an entertaining evening with good company and food! Our bill was worth every penny.

If you enjoy tepan grills this place is worth checking out. Food is always delicious and servers always entertain, regardless of age. Their sushi is fresh and tasty. There are certain rolls I love (like the Blue Diamond Roll, YUM!) and others I'm not particularly a fan of, but that's more a matter of taste rather than quality. The tepanyaki is delicious. I've had the chicken, steak, and shrimp with fried rice --- SO GOOD! I also appreciate that when I come here with a group of friends or just my boyfriend they'll allow me to sit at the grill if I only wish to order sushi. Granted, most of my visits have been during their slower times but I still very much appreciate that they offer it. My only complaint is that every time I visit, slow or busy, I have a very difficult time getting a second refill from my server. This only really bothers me because I can be with one or two others who get three or four refills and I will have to flag them down to ask for one. Nonetheless I always come back because their prices are really competitive and the food is phenomenal.
Fantastic food like always. Have to say that location on Decatur is way better then one on Flamingo. love this place

Celebrated birthday here. Great value and dinner was great. Filet was tender and salmon was well prepared with great flavoring. Good choice of noodles or rice with the dinner- different than most Japanese steakhouses that I've experienced. Will plan to go again!

PROS:
-I haven't been to the steakhouse side, but I heard its super awesome!
-Efficient & nice service :)
-Great sashimi
-I love how they options in their menu that saids "chefs choice" because we don't need to stress about ordering certain food

FOOD 5/5:
