-Blue Diamond Dinner Special ($23.95): 2 special rolls + 8 pieces of sashimi & nigiri
-Blue Diamond Roll: shrimp tempura, crab, avocado & sliced lemon on top = amazing!
-Yellowtail nigiri: Personal favorite. I love how juicy & thick the fish slices were
-Tuna nigiri: BOMB
-Salmon nigiri: BOMB

I can't wait to come back and try more food options :)
By far my favorite Japanese Steakhouse! The rice is perfect, not too salty. Everything here is just right. Prices are reasonable, too. Skip Geisha and Benihana, Ohjah is the place to go!

Had a very nice meal here; Unagi nigiri, mixed tempura, miso.  I lived in Japan awhile and I was very impressed with the authenticity and quality.   They also have teppanyaki.  Of course watching the Cubbies win while dining helped!
I don't know what it is about their combination fried rice, but every time I order it, the planets seem to align and all seems right in the world.

This a great neighborhood Japanese joint.  Not the best, not the worst, but always solid.  I've been here enough that I found certain staples that I always get:  Garlic Edamame, Japanese Spring Rolls, Soft Shell Crab, SOB roll...There is also very delicious Hibachi here.

Left another sushi bar not far away. Had some of the best sushi ever. The chef is a master. The food is phenomenal. Had The freshest largest Uni I've ever seen. Great food both in the Hibachi grill and now at the sushi bar. I have never gone to the same restaurant twice in 1 trip. Awesome place. Don't bother going anywhere else in Vegas.

Love Ohjah! Every time I come the guy at the front is very welcoming and accommodating he must be the owner or manager very sweet guy!  I just walked in and ordered a to go order and they were so fast! It only took a few minutes. Highly recommend Ohjah! Food, atmosphere and employees are all five star!
We ordered appetizers, sushi, beef sukiyaki and teriyaki chicken and fried rice.  Everything was delicious.  Very flavorful.  Will come back for sure !

this place is the absolute worst. me and my friend wen there, shes from fort lauderdale fl and i decided i would take her somewhere nice but inexpensive since i've been there before and it was okay... but after tonight i will never step feet int hat place again. first the chef was sloppy, unhappy, and catch an attitude with the lady that was sitting across from us because the waitress forgot one of the fried rice she ordered so she brought it to his attention(the chef) and he said "i have nothing to do with that, ask her for another one". the chef didnt make it fun while all the other hibachi tables was excited and making noises we were the most quite table ever. so then after he cooked the fried rice which wasnt good, it was mushy(since when are fried rice mushy?) no seasoning what so ever, to make it worst, i found freaking multiple pieces of tissue cooked in to my rice"SO DISGUSTING" like i was literally chewing paper, gross! i brought it to the chef attention and he didnt even apologize, he walked away and got the manager(a male) and guess what he said "its from my straw, sure because i am a 3 year old baby who would take paper from a straw and mixed it in to my rice then try to eat it, are you kidding me? he didn't even offer to do anything about it so we just asked for the check and i attempted to search the rice again, guess what? more paper. when the lady brought the check, i said "do you still think i put straw paper in there (showing her other pieces of napkin) lol this is funny, she said "ITS JUST PAPER, ITS OKAY" i guess shes used to eating paper at home so i basically payed for food that i didnt not eat.... never again.

Great new dinner option for people in the Southern Highlands area. Great sushi but there is no all you can eat. The hibachi is super affordable compared to some other local places and just as good if not better.
Having a great dinner out with the family with the great people at OHJAH. Our favorite Sushi Chef Larry and our waitress is Marina. Always fresh fish always clean and delicious
Great sushi.  Though not all you can eat.  The Holy Moly appetizer is AWESOME

Went here for date night & were pleasantly surprised! Who knew that this hidden gem was right here in this little strip mall. Awesome food & show at the hibachi. Everything was so fresh & flavorful......we will definitely be back. Prices were very reasonable & a great value for the money.

I've been here about 5 times in the past year since I've known about this joint. I've had their chicken katsu dish and I've had their chicken teriyaki bento box that comes with gyoza, white rice, california rolls and side salad and they did not disappoint.

I like the fact that you get a good sized meal for a fair price and the staff is always friendly and attentive. I would like this place even more if they carried brown rice, but unfortunately they don't.

I highly recommend this joint If your in the area looking for a quick bite and don't want to spend more than $15 on a meal.

Location is just perfect! The food are great and inexpensive. They have fast and friendly service from the moment you walk in til you leave you're greeted with a smile. 
Overall I highly recommend this place for everyone.

Great little place in Southwest Vegas off Blue Diamond.  Great hibachi.  Think, juicy meat sauteed just perfectly.  Real good sushi rolls as well.  Can't go wrong with this place either way whether you choose hibachi, japanese entrees, or sushi.
One of the best restaurants in our neighborhood.the hibachi cook is so funny!can't stop laughing!!!food is fresh every time.kobe beef is the bomb!!definally worth the price.this place is awesome!!!

Tried this out after our favorite sushi place closed, and we were not disappointed. A lot of rolls to choose from, a nice atmosphere, and the staff was super friendly. Everything tasted fresh, and everything we tried was good. We'll definitely go back.

The garlic edamame is my favorite here than the rest of the restaurants in Vegas.  The crazy jalapeno is delicious.  This are my top 2 dishes here.  I like the choices in wine and the yelp free sake is great to have.  The option of hibachi, sushi, or both is terrific.  Come try this location or any of the other Ohjah properties

Cody was hands down the best server we have encountered here. 
We will come back if he is working 
Unassuming 
Attentive 
Polite
Perfect Xmas

Love this place once again. Spend the evening here, food was excellent, Saki was good and the kids had such a great time watching the tiny show they perform. Prices are reasonable here we feel. Overall - we love this place and will be coming back again!

Great food and fun atmosphere. My husband and I actually love this place and think the price is reasonable. The reason for my three star instead of five star rating is because of the "extra charges" they put on our last bill. We spent almost $200 on food, so to be charged for something like refills on the iced tea was very annoying! We were celebrating a birthday and anniversary, we asked the waitress if they would sing happy birthday. They sang and brought out a small piece of cheesecake, then charged us for the cheesecake! I have never been charged for a "birthday" dessert! I'm sorry but if I just spent almost $200 on food the least you could do is throw in the slice of birthday cake. I really like this place but charging us for those silly things will make me think twice about going there next time. In fact, the next time I have a craving I will try the hibachi place closer to my house.

This restaurant is a great alternative to other higher priced hibachi chains. The service was friendly, our on-stage chef was entertaining, and the food was well-seasoned and cooked just right. 

If you're looking for a family-friendly, fun Japanese dinner out in the Vegas area, I would recommend Ohjah's!
The best hibachi in town! Went there for my daughter birthday handle the big group excellent service. Highly recommend it, great food!!
Not impressed with the chef! Threw pepper in my drink. Not very personable. Food was good.

Came here to do hibachi style dining with my friend. We ordered the hibachi combination which allows you to pick three choices of protein which we picked New York steak, shrimp, and scallop. All of this was $31. Which was a great deal. We also ordered a sushi roll. It was love something roll we asked the server for recommend and she recommended that roll and it was really good and refreshing. The scallop for the hibachi was nice big and juicy. It wasn't cheap and small which was awesome! The steak was delicious and good quality and the fried rice was cooked perfectly with enough flavor. The onions in the veggies was very delicious too. Seriously loved everything about this place. Great service too. It's affordable hibachi here and the quality of the food was very good.

I had a pretty big issue with my steak being undercooked on my last visit. I contacted the restaurant and Peter (the manager answered) he offered to tread my girlfriend and I for a second chance. So we took him u pin his offer and chef Van was cooking for us. He did an excellent job they made us feel at home. Peter apologized for the inconvenience. And I couldn't have been happier. Great place for a first date by the way.
Great place to eat. Food, service, and atmosphere was great, for a reasonable price. We did the Hibachi Grill and everyone had a great time.

I like this place cause it's very close to the place i'm staying at. Word to the wise, if you order carryout sushi, and you order a baked roll, it's pretty gross once you get home. I had those same baked rolls when I actually sat down, and it was pretty good. 15 min of driving ruins baked sushi, i guess. lol. Service is great.

Note: Can't comment on the hibachi because we did not choose that option.

Came here for a dinner with the family as a first-timer and I was pleasantly surprised. The food is great. I recommend trying the Holy Moly and Gyu-Ishiyaki for starters.

Service was great as well. We were served by a really nice young lady (I forgot her name, sorry) who was extremely polite.

A great place to try if you're undecided on a Japanese restaurant. :)

Service is always excellent here, the staff is quick and friendly, and the chefs put on a good show.

Food if great! The hibachi special is the way to go. The New York steak is a good cut, and the calamari is cooked perfectly.

The atmosphere is cozy with dim lighting.

Fast and friendly service.  
Our first meal in Vegas! Woohoooo!! 
Waiting for our food nomnom. I'll update what the food taste

4 out of 6 of us got sick... really sick. Vomiting and shitting at the same time.. go here if you want food poisoning. Spent $500 these people have no shame taking your money but when you call back the next day saying something is wrong and it's because of unsanitary food they don't care... calling the health department in the morning

Great affordable hibachi for locals. I've been to Ohjah several times and thoroughly enjoy this place!

The grillmasters are entertaining as always (I still can never catch the shrimps in my mouth for the life of me) and the service hasn't disappointed yet. 

I have tried the filet mignon, Sukiyaki beef, salmon teriyaki, and the scallops. The filet mignon is my absolute favorite, it MELTS in your mouth. Filet would definitely be my recommendation for first timers and meat lovers.

The portions are filling as with your main hibachi dish you also receive: onion soup (I request for miso soup instead), house salad, grilled veggies, and your choice of fried rice or noodles.

For those who live southwest or nearby, I definitely recommend trying out Ohjah if you're in the mood for hibachi!
Ninja roll is amazing. So is their tuna tataki. I have never been disappointed at this location.

we visited ohjah for the first time on my bf's bday. we got to the restaurant at around 6:30pm and there was not a lot of people at the place so we were seated right away. our waitress was polite and friendly. since it was our first time at the place, she explained to us how hibachi works. she is very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and answered all our questions. she suggested which was good to try, and we did, and they were really good and tasty. overall, the food was great, the services was perfect. the chefs are funny and very entertaining. they know their way on knives and food. the price was very reasonable. the place was also clean and neat.

I live close to this place and have been there a couple times now. The food is just ok. The service is terrible!!!! Some of the worst service I have ever encountered in Las Vegas. The employees are clueless. Even the manager seems like he doesn't even know what his doing. I will never go here again and don't recommend anyone to do so if you want to have a pleasant lunch/dinner.

I typically come here for my coworkers get togethers but last month I had one of my birthday celebrations here. It was so nice because the Hibachi is not only delicious but the prices are really reasonable. They are also very accommodating because one of my friends brought me a cake and they were nice enough to keep it in their fridge till after our meal. When our meal was finished the waiter cut the cake and served it. They were busy that night but they didn't rush us out. The service and food is excellent! I can't wait till they open the one on Hualapai and Flamingo!

The ojah hibachi is a restaurant that my bf and i truly enjoy. The food is good and the shows are always fun. There are some wonderful chefs like the sir in the yellow hat who is our favorite. HOWEVER, today I had an unpleasant experience with a newer, inexperienced employee.

We brought our friends here and the chef we were given was inexperienced not just for the hibachi show (which wasnt much of a show), but apparently also in cooking. We noticed first that he burned the egg and the portion sizes of food was not enough for the table of 9 people... to the point some people had remnants of vegetables....

The vegetables were not fully cooked- cold and too crunchy. The noodles were ill seasoned. 
My boyfriend ordered a rare stake (we also had rare filet yesterday) and it was RAW. NOT RARE. THERE IS A DIFFERENCE. It was cold like fridge cold in the middle, half was cooked rare and the rest raw. Rare steak is not supposed to be Cold!!!We had filet at Mon Ami Gabi yestrday and it was no where near that infact it was perfectly cooked.

After confronting the manager he kindly went to make a new one for us.

Then. THE PREVIOUS CHEF CAME TO ARGUE WITH US!!!!! HE DIDN'T EVEN APOLOGIZE JUST STRAIGHT UP ARGUING! 

The manager apologized for the chefs behavior and generously compted the steak meal. As well as preparing a better one.

I normally love the hibachi here and the chef in the yellow hat, but this one chef was just inexcusable. Thankfully the manager did his best to help resolve the situation.
And also, I do realize that some situations isnt necessarily the restaurants fault but sometimes employees mistakes, the food was still pleasing and at least the rest of the crew was still kind and concerned about our enjoyment- which I do appreciate. The manager even called us later to apologize which is a very honest and respectable thing to do, I appreciate and accept the apology. I know it wasn't his fault.

Service: Outstanding! Everyone in the restaurant wore a smile and had a great positive attitude! I give 5 STARs just on the service.

Appetizer:  Fried Oysters.  I am from Eastern NC, so I typically like my fried oysters in a light batter.  The fried oysters batter was very thick and greasy.  It was also served with BBQ sauce.  

Dinner: The salad dressing that they serve is different.  It's almost like a mayo based ginger salad dressing.  It was not my favorite. I like that the portions are not HUGE, so you could actually finish it.  I like that the chef was VERY accommodating of how I wanted my food to be cooked.  He was very happy to cook my food separately.
Service was good, our rolls came out extremely quickly. The rolls had too much rice for my taste but it was decent 3/5 stars.

I've been here 3-4 times and have had fairly good experiences most of the time. Seen a couple of dirty forks that I've had swapped out but usually don't have complaints about the food. 

This last experience is what dropped my rating. While eating I found hair in my rice. I showed it to the waitress and she was nice and apologetic. So was the chef. They asked if I wanted them to take my plate away.  She then offered to remake the dish. I told them yes but asked for it in a to-go container since the rest of my party would be finishing up by the time I got my food. 

Throughout this process I was extremely polite and understanding. As gross as it is.. I understand that things happen. I received my to-go order and my bill... 100% of my bill. Due to the inconvenience of having to wait for my food I believe I should have received some sort of discount. I'm naturally passive but someone else in my party felt it was unacceptable and requested it on my behalf. The manager offered 10%.... $3 and some change. 

When I got home and checked my order... the protein portions were incredibly tiny. Nothing close to what you would receive dining in. Tasted fine though and no stray hairs that I could find. 

Just overall bad service recovery experience. Due to cleanliness concerns and this last experience I probably won't return.

After 6 years of frequenting this restaurant (Decatur and Blue Diamond), we thought we had seen it all! That's until we encountered Pariseth (the Hibachi cook) who is an artist behind the Teppan (grill). I've never seen such a show! He's amazing at his craft and great with people. If you are anywhere close to this location- ask for him....if you're not, I would make the trip.....it's worth it.

This place is amazing. I have been to the 215 and Flamingo place and the menu is the same, interior very different here. The nigiri hamachi is melt-in-your-mouth fantastic. Excellent menu, fast friendly service. Reasonably priced drinks and appetizers. The sushi is fresh and delicious. The only drawback is it is not open until 3pm, I tried coming here for lunch on a Saturday and it was not open. But dinner is terrific, check this place out!!

This place was great. The hibachi was pretty decent for my first time. Customer service was awesome there are some pretty cool people that worked there. Food was amazing and I had the fried ice cream for the first time too ughh melted in my mouth lol the price actually isn't too bad either. You'd think it would be more expensive than it is. I wanna go atleast once a month definitely would recommend it.

3.5 stars

Ohjah doesn't rise nor sinks when compared to other Japanese restaurants, they just provide decent food with good service. Their sushi reflected that mayonaise, rice, and raw fish do not bode well together. Our party ordered three rolls but it was difficult to distinguish which was which. Each was slammed with 10 lbs. of spicy mayo and sweet eel sauce over flavorless spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, avocado, and/or cream cheese. Maybe we ordered the wrong things, but the phrase, "Which roll is this again?" was spouted during the course of the meal. 

If there was a shining light in the meal, it was my hot entree. I actually enjoyed my spicy chicken. They were generous with their meat, the veggies were cooked perfectly, and it came with soup and salad. However, they should omit spicy from the description. It was more sweet and salty. I asked for extra spice but instead got an extra layer of red sauce. Other parts of the meal included a well excuted tempura. In the end, they gave pre-packaged hand cloths to wipe away all the grime and residue of your greasy claws. They have a hibachi grill if you want entertainment and flames. The atmosphere evokes dark and romantic but the clienteles are big-ass families with waistlines that match.

The hardest thing to achieve in a restaurant is consistency.  Often we go somewhere and LOVE it, then the next time its blah.  Not the case with Ohjah!  We go there about every 2 weeks and its ALWAYS AWESOME.   Sometimes the company is better than others,  some chefs are more skilled with the knives than others, but the FOOD is Always PERFECT.   You won't hear me say that too often, so trust me when I do. 
The pricing of the menu is more competitive than other Japanese steak houses.  Its $8,95 base price for the rice veggies and soup, then you ad your meats.  We usually have the Filet Mignon plus either shrimp, scallops, chicken or halibut.  The filet is like meat flavored butter, melts in your mouth.   Actually I wish they used a little more butter in the prep, but its always flavorful and healthy. 

We do usually get a tuna sashimi but I will say this.  the fish is fresh and yummy, BUT its cut in too large of chunks.  I prefer a smaller cut for a more delicate taste and feel.  We ate at the sushi bar once and all the fish was cut too large. 

Nevertheless,  the The steakhouse, hibachi grill is the BEST in town for the BEST price.  I highly recommend it any day.
Best Sushi in town!   Peter the manager is super!!   Tiffany the server is so sweet and very attentive!
Great Atmosphere, fun for families as well as couples, service and crowd pleasing performance, the steak and sushi are high quality

Very excellent food for a great price. I had the combination teppanyaki with filet mignon, teriyaki chicken, and shrimp, the fried rice and vegetables were included and delicious. All for the price of $30. The chef was hilarious...that's only if you can take a joke. 

The only thing could've done better was to have more tricks while cooking. But everything was great.

I took my brother in law here for his 21st birthday. I was a couple days late, I couldn't get off work during week.

But we called on way to restaurant and made quick reservations. We get there and instantly seated. I been waiting to try the hibachi for 1st and 2nd time here and our timing was off, but this time we were in.

So we started with some sake, our salad and onion soup which are both very good! The salad is my favorite. I gave up rice for lent so fried noodles it is. The fried noodle was very good!

I got the combo with 3 choices. I got scallops, filet mignon, and shrimp. I got this the very first time we can here but no hibachi show, it was lunch time. Food was 5 stars on its own. 

Next our show, I forgot his name we had a couple bottles of sake. I guess we were waiting for more people for our table and they were very late and gave us complimentary edamame on the house while we waited. Very nice of them. Our show was the very fun! We all caught shrimp in our mouth. We had a blast, the price was right. Great food, service, fun. We will back soon, thank you Ohjah.
Great food! Family friendly and service was awesome! Get off the strip and come here!
AMAZING!!!  Went with friends and the kids and my girlfriend couldn't get enough!!  Will DEFINITELY be back next time in Vegas!!

This is one of our staple restaurants. There isn't usually a wait, but it does get busy and lively. We haven't tried the hibachi yet, but are looking forward to it. 

The miso soup is good, and because I'm pregnant I haven't tried too much sushi. I did get a tempura shrimp roll once and was disappointed that the batter was soggy instead of crunchy. However, I recently had the shrimp tempura entree, and it was dynamite, so they clearly can make a mean tempura if they want. The tempura dipping sauce was a little bland. Many of their sushi specialty rolls tend to be on the hot side rather than sweet. I usually don't eat California rolls, but my husband did the other day, and it was the best CA roll I've ever had. It left me scratching my head wondering how a CA roll could be so good.

Their teriyaki is pretty good. Sometimes the chicken is dry, but the New York steak is consistently good, and tender for NY. They reportedly make their own teriyaki sauce, and do not use MSG, huge plus.

As for sides, their rice can be inconsistent, but their salads have good dressing and are pretty darn good for iceberg lettuce.

The service is decent, but there are some new servers who do things like put the food on the middle or end of the table instead of in front of the person who ordered it. Usually not a biggie, unless its hot soup they put in front of a young child...

That aside, it's one of our favorite "regular" places.

Been to the hibachi twice, so I can't comment on the sushi bar. 
The service is great and the food is even better. Try the scallops, they are excellent.

Why is everyone voting 4 stars?? haha.  this place is awesome, I've been here more then 5 times.  They have a great deal which is like 3 rolls for 23 dollars or so(specialty rolls) and that should be more then enough for yourself depending on the roll.  I have never been to the hibachi but I'm sure thats good too!.  and the waitresses are cute too!  ;).

Came here when it was about 30 minutes before closing. We told the host stand we'll just get it for togo but the manager insisted we stayed. We knew we were gonna get mediocre to okay service.. BUT NO! we got a horrible service. never coming back again.

The caterpillar roll is my favorite. The hot edamames are great to start :) 
The first time I was here it was a great experience! My friends and I ordered their boat special- which was so filling we didn't even eat all the sushi. 
You choose three different sushi rolls and it comes with sashimi as well for $45- which I think is cheap compared to other places. 
Their Rock N Roll roll was a refreshing taste, it had salmon, tuna, avocado, and yellowtail wrapped in cucumber (a big roll but still tasty). 
Their baked mussels are juicy and tender. 
The service here is amazing. They're very attentive and always remember you whenever you visit :)

I really enjoyed this place. Its very typical of what i expect from a Japanese Steakhouse and Hibachi room. They also had sushi and a limited thai menu making it great for a large group with varying tastes. They didnt do Hibachi at the normal tables which I found a bit shortsided. Many friends like Hibachi but they dont like the smell their clothes take on. Overall, the service was very on point, prices were very reasonable, food quality was very good. The filet I had was good, but not the highest quality. The chef cooking was alot of fun. Had a few new tricks I haven't seen. Another must visit destination.
I think this place is better than Benihana or Tokyo Waco. Good food for a Teppan place. I only tried one roll, but will def come back.

Wonderful food and very good service. My husband and I have tried the Habachi grill which is superb, the regular menu is varied and everything we have ordered has been tasty. There is never a wait for a table or a place at the grill. I have not tried the sushi but it looks good.

I usually go there have sushi.
I went there to have late lunch with my friend.
We had ohjah boat with my favorite rolls(dark cycle, cowboy, gentlemen's club).
Very good price, 3 rolls were very tasty and sashimi was fresh. Service is always good.
I always go there to have sushi. Haven't tried hibachi yet... Hibachi area is always busy. I will try hibachi next time for sure.

In my opinon this is the best Hibachi grill for the price in town. The food is always fresh and my g/f loves the cheap Sake! Enough said! I always tell everybody that they should make reservations because they are always busy. In fact I just made one just now for 7pm!
Amazing food, amazing service.... You can't go wrong with hibachi. Bar only has beer, wine and Japanese drinks.

This place is amazing. The staff is always so accommodating and since we come here quite often they always acknowledge us. 
The space isn't much to look at from the outside but as my mother always says, it's what's inside that counts!
There are 3 types of seating..the Sushi Bar, regular dining off the menu and hibachi dining. We generally always go to hibachi. 
The menu consists of the usual steak, chicken and shrimp but the also offer Kobe beef, lobster, salmon and scallops. You get your choice of fried rice or noodles and you start with onion soup and ginger salad. The salad dressing they use is amazing and unique. 
We always each order a steak and split the lobster. Make sure to have them cook with garlic and give you a side of teriyaki sauce for your rice, you won't regret it!  
We come here at least once every other month and it still feels like a treat. Can't wait to go back!

Been here several times already and I love the Sushi.  When I grow tired of the AYCE quality and I am craving some nice high quality Sushi this is my new haunt.

I can only comment on the Sushi Bar since I have not tried the Teppan. I am a Nigiri Sushi addict. I am a big fan of everything in the refrigerated case in font of me at this sushi bar. So if you ask me what I like, I can just point to the general area of the fish and say "all of that." The only thing that I have found that doesn't blow me away, and this is strictly a personal preference, was the cure on the Saba. Still better than many others though. The daily specials on the board are well worth the price and I have not been anything but satisfied with anything I have ordered from it. I usually order an appetizer, a meal, and whatever fancies me from the specials board and I am happy.

They have great deals to fit whatever mood you are in. The service is always friendly and attentive.  The restaurant is always clean. The last time I visited it sounded like a party in the Teppan area. I have to try that next visit.

everything was amazing! we will definitely be coming back!, the way they make tricks with the food  omg amazing  I never seen in my life, the volcano fire going up through a onion. people should really come to ohjah n enjoin the amazing and good time that it will have as a family

Staff is very friendly which is why they get 2 stars.  I ordered 3 sushi rolls, fried oysters, spicy beef dinner and some saki.  The sushi rolls were very bland, and the pieces were very small,especially for the price.  The fried oysters were basic and the batter is standard, not different that stands out.  Spicy beef did not have spice but did have some flavor, asked the server if it had green peppers and he did not seem to understand due to language barrier, but I'm not a fan of green peppers.  Overall food was bland, atmosphere and service is nice.  Better sushi joints out there

Chef Von makes our experience great. He's not cheesy. He's so funny. Super cute. The food is fresh and the salad dressing is amazing. I'm never going back to Benihana again. This place is so much better tasting and so much better pricing!!!!

My review is on the Hibachi dinner, as we did not have sushi when we went. I do want to say that I become more and more dismayed at the number of sushi establishments that don't even offer a simple Spice Crab roll muchless a specialty roll with spicy crab in it. It seems when I ask for this 'unheard' of ingredient they look at me as if I have a third eye or something and unfortunately their answer to spicy crab = "a california roll with siracha rolled into it" is unacceptable. For those who do not know how to make spicy crab it is merely imitation crab stick chopped up just like they do for the crab salad with a tad bit of siracha and japanese mayo. The sad thing is that the easy way would be to just chop up a crabstick and mix it with the already available Spicy Mayo.... just sayin' 

But I digress - the hibachi menu requires that you order the 8.95 base selection which is just your soup, salad, veggies and rice. Scroll down the menu a bit and it gives you the selection of meats and fishes that they serve Hibachi style. Kobe beef runs 48.95. We chose to have the Hibachi combo which allows you to choose 3 selections (excluding Lobster, Halibut and Kobe) but is a nice plethora of flavors that you can try as your meal.

The chefs are very entertaining, the meal is exciting to watch and the final outcome was really delicious. We didn't want for drinks until after the show was over and then we had to flag someone down a couple of times. Not terrible but they had spoiled us during the show serving us every time the glass became half empty.

I would definitely like to go back and see if they can do better with their response for Spicy Crab :-)

I love this place! We live close by decided to stop in and wow in looks small but it is really big! Sushi bar, private booths, and a hibachi dining area. I am always iffy when it comes to sushi and the quality but this place is outstanding! The hibachi style dining is delicious and GREAT prices! The filet was so tender! You cant beat the prices here and you will always leave full and satisfied! Probably my top 3 fav restaurants in Vegas!

I have been here several times for hibachi dinner and I can tell you that your dining experience here will depend on which chef perform/cook your meal. One chef will give you a 5 stars experience while the other one will make you question yourself for why the hell you're spending a lot of money for a lousy meal.

My regular and favorite chef is the tall skinny (Viet) chef who always does an excellent job entertaining guests and also make a good meal. When you go to a hibachi dinner, you expect entertainment in addition to good food. As for the other chef who cooked one of my meals, granted he was very nice, he basically just focused on cooking the food and not very entertaining at all. Even worse, the food was salty and just overall not good.

Since you are sharing the hibachi cooking table with other guests, I'm not sure if you can choose which chef will cook your dinner. Due to this reason, I am now less likely to take my guests here for dinner, which is too bad since this experience is unique and could be a lot of fun compared to strip buffet.

If you plan to come here for hibachi dinner, make sure you understand the rule of roulette. Your dining experience could land on red or black, and sometimes green :-)

It was ok but nothing special. I had the New York steak which had a lot of fat in it. My friend had the chicken and said it was really good.  My water was empty for some time and I saw the server in the corner chatting with another server. I finally gave up and refilled the water on my own.  I won't be back.

Our group of 6 red heads gathered around, We had a lovely dinner and each of our special dietary needs were catered to. 

The chef was awesome, he was fun and entertaining with every one of us. The chicken, steak and shrimp was all cooked to perfection, and our one girl who had sushi all raved about what they ate. 

I would most certainly go back!
Great place I gotta remember that when we come to Vegas we always make a stop here five star ...love it....

I wish I could give this place 2.5 stars, but I'll give it 3 because it doesn't deserve a flat 2. As soon as we arrived, the host skipped us and went to a group of guests that arrived after us. No biggie, but we sat down and realized that it was hot as a sauna. We asked them to turn down the air but it remained a steamy cesspool of sweat and spice throughout our meal. The server confused our drinks a few times, again no biggie. But the main course came out before my appetizer, and my spicy beef had two bones in it. Nothing like killing your appetite trying to bite into a crunchy bone. The food tasted decent, but nothing great. The combination of meh service, extreme heat, and bones just killed it for me. Might have just come on off night but this was massively disappointing for all the good reviews I've read.

Went here last night, ordered the 3 special rolls combo and I can't believe that I can finish that by myself ..yummy,i forgot to take pictures because when I realized that ,I finish that already ! Looking forward to the next time I go,and definitely I will come back!

What a great place to eat in SW Las Vegas!  We live in the area and decided to visit the place once it opened.  We are very fond of the Hibachi style Japanese restaurants, and we were floored at the more-than-reasonable pricing!  Salad, soup, fried rice, vegetables and my shrimp all came out to less than $20!  It was tasty and the atmosphere is classy but fun.  I would highly recommend!

This place is pretty new in our area.  It's pretty wicked to have a Japanese spot with in walking distance from our house.  I watched this place being built and couldn't wait for the day the doors were open.  My wife and I finally went here for dinner when we had a visitor from Cali.  I would like to think of myself as a sushi purist and typically I don't consider eating hibachi.  Call me stuck up but, I always felt that hibachi was a bit "touristy" and more like Japanese for the "newbie".  

Anyhow, this visit made me cheat on my first love, sushi.  I loved this place and the prices were super competitive.  We started with sake bombs that were only $2, cheap!  I got the strip steak dinner and it was only about $15 - $16.  The steak and fried rice were delicious.  That week we actually went there 3 times!  

The staff is super friendly.  Every time we went the chef's were always personable and a little sarcastic, in a good way.  We actually found out that Ohjah means, King of the Ninjas.  Cool!  Also, if you just want to try out there menu a good time to go is during lunch cause the prices are a bit lower.  I would go again and I do recommend going as a group for the hibachi dinner.

I had heard a lot of good things about Ohjah an wanted to try it for my birthday. We had made an appointment for a regular table but changed it to the hibachi when we got there. They were nice and were able to fit us into a table.  

The chef we got was really good at cooking, but he had ZERO interaction with our table at all. He went through the motions and while it was all very impressive, he never smiled or laughed or acknowledged us. It was a bit strange.  

The food was delicious!  We shared the Hibachi combo, with one basic to share, and it was the perfect amount. The scallops were cooked perfectly, as was the steak and shrimp.  I really wanted the oysters on the half shell or oyster shooters, but they didn't have any so ended up getting a "screaming orgasm" and that was okay. It was a very small portion compared to other places. 

When most everyone at our table was done eating, the servers seemed in a rush to get us out, but we wanted to linger and try some dessert and drink more wine. It was a bit uncomfortable. They kept bringing our check and we kept asking for more things so they'd have to take it back. We were the only ones left at the table and I felt bad - I wanted to ask if we could move to a normal table since we weren't ready to leave yet, but the server told us we were fine, even though they kept bringing us our check lol.  

All in all, the food was great, the service was fast, and it was a great birthday dinner.

Don't expect much.  I regret coming here.  I think what pretty much set the tone for my meal is when our server seemed like she was trying to convince us not to order our food when we were giving her our list of what we wanted.  She said it was a lot and when I said yes it is-she stood there like I was going to change my mind.  
Specialty and signature rolls are ok, but pork katsu dinner was very dry.  
I give credit to the sushi chefs but other than that I will not be coming back here.  I don't want to be offended when I order the food I want-like I don't know what just came out of my mouth.  Yes I'm hungry and yes I eat a lot.

We sat at the hibachi table and had a fantastic meal. There were 5 of us including a teen. We had chicken, a filet, salmon, shrimp and lobster. We also ordered a couple of sushi rolls. The food was delicious and we did not go home hungry. The staff was friendly and happy to help. Plus, the price was just right. There are so many menu options, I will definitely return.
Each time I come here it reminds me of why I keep coming back. Great edamame, great teriyaki scallops!

Had another wonderful dinner with great friendly service. Will be coming back to try out some of their other delicious baked sushi next time!

This was the best Japanese restaurant we ever ate.
Our waitress  was the most wonderful
Food is very good and priced reasonably, large portions, the 3 combo is the best value, we got the filet and ny steak with scallops
Absolutely fantastic food, great service and reasonable prices.  Had the vegetable Pad Thai and it was amazing.
Chicken Yakisoba was so-so but the sushi and teriyaki beef made up for it by far.  I'm already thinking about whether it's unreasonable to go back two days in a row just for the Shogun roll.

I come here a lot! I had one bad experience but 100 good ones! It's the place where i came to celebrate my wedding, birthdays... i really like this place and recommend it! Today is my hubby birthday and here we are again!

The restaurant staff is amazing here! I came here recently with my family and they were extremely friendly and accommodating. They were constantly checking on us and making sure the food and drinks were ok. Not to mention the food is awesome! Great sushi and Thai food. Definitely want to go back and try other items on the menu. Our server Felicia was amazing and she was super sweet! All in all... Highly recommend this place!

brand new hibachi/sushi joint at reasonable prices!

we've been to ohjah (or king of the ninjas so the hibachi chef tells us!) on multiple occasions since its just around the corner from our house.  at first, i thought this place wasn't going to do well since the location is kind of weird (off blue diamond and decatur, but in a tiny side shopping center thats pretty much empty).  but right when this place opened, we've noticed its been packed... all the time!

the sushi... awesome!  very fresh and the flavors are great.  they have a ton of variety too.  prices are pretty sushi normal (expect about 10ish bucks for a specialty roll, 5ish for the standard rolls).  we got the volcano roll, tiger roll, and a bunch of nigiri (white fish nigiri... sooo good!).  all the sushi, excellent.  the volcano roll was covered in this interesting mix of scallops and sauce.  my kind of roll!

the hibachi was cool too.  i love the prices... its a lot cheaper than most hibachi places i've tried before.  you pay $8.95 for the hibachi basics then add on your meats for around 6 bucks (more expensive for better meats of course).  the food was pretty good and the chef was truly entertaining.  he was super ninja with his tricks and we all were able to catch the shrimp in our mouths.  boom!

the place is stylish and the service is nice.  their only fault i think is that the waitresses always try to up sell you to more things at the beginning (but it doesn't bother me that much).  

definitely a must try!

This was our second time here. We went in when they first opened. 
We were not impressed then. 
But tonight we wanted to get out & after checking Yelp we decided to give it another try. 
They are located within walking distance of our house. 
WOW! I'm so glad we went back! Fantastic food. Ambiance was great. Service was very good. We had Hibachi style. Sat with a blended family with 4 kids. We had a ball. Entertained by these kids. 
Back to the food. I had Filet Mignon & hubby had a Lobster Tail. We shared. Fried rice & veggies. Yum! Yum!
All I can say is go. Inexpensive, good service & Fantastic food!!!
We will be back!
Love love love it here! Sushi is kinda pricey but several options. But so worth the price! Teppan is great and entertaining! You won't be disappointed

Oyishi ( meaning very good in japanese) for Ohjah!! I freaking love this place! My friend and I decided to give this place a try, she had told me this place had so many good reviews and the pictures made us drool!!! YELP REVIEWS did not lie! This was so gooooooood!!

We started witht he Edame and the wontons.. Very delicious not that pricey about $3.95 each for appetizers..

Then for our entree we ordered the Ohjah boat which consisted of 3 rolls of your choice along with sashimi and seaweed salad for $49

And also we ordered the New York Steak Teriyaki..$14.99

From the moment they served the food we were in awe., Loved the presentation and love how the Boat full of sushi was huge! Loved the detail with the food presentation as well. The sushi was amazing! It melted in your mouth and you can tell the sashimi was fresh with the correct temperature without the VEINS popping in your mouth! As for the teriyaki steak it was to die for!

So in the end we couldnt finish everything.. we didnt even need to order appetizers we were so full we had so much left overs from the sushi and the steaks..

But of course we still made room for their famous tempura icecream which was so good!

I must say you can tell a huge difference when ordering from an all you can eat sushi place.. 

Ohjah is one of my top 5 japanese place and I will of course return  and will be a loyal customer!


P.S. they also have the hibachi tables if you are into that..
We come here often and love the consistency of our rolls. They serve the best non filtered sake. The staff is friendly and very attentive.

We tried the Hibachi Grill!

We came in on a Friday night with a party of 11 for a birthday party but they seated us in less then 5 minutes (reservations helped). All the seats at all 6 hibachi stations were maxed out.  Really impressed with how fast we got in there.  Most places even with reservations you still have to wait a little.

All of us ordered the three choice option at the grill which was a lot of food for under $32.  I did shrimp, calamari, and chicken with noodles!  Oh wee it hit the spot!

The ambience is fairly quiet until the chefs do their thing to entertain then the sound level spikes up, but that's the whole experience it's part of the fun.  My kids (8, 6, 5) haven't had a hibachi experience since they were babies so they finally got to enjoy it.

I checked in and got a free Sake!  Thank you for a great Friday Night!

Habachi at it finest. Not only do they do habachi, but they do a variety of sushi rolls. Perfectly priced for your wallet and it fun to end the night catching a shrimp with your mouth. 
If you don't know what I'm talking well. 
It's a dinner and a showmanship by the cook. 
You pick your meat and  a cook comes out with meat and veggies to grill in front of you. He will also made fried rice in front of you and make a volcano  out of onions. It's really fun. I took my in laws and they loved it.

I love this place food is always great ! Service is always fast an friendly ;)  
I've never had a bad visit. I would highly recommend it :)

REVIEW for SUSHI not HIBACHI.

This place was really good. I wanted to make sure I wrote a review because it's somewhat off the beaten path in a small "strip mall" area next to a liquor store. Place could be easily missed.

 Tried several items on the menu (some lunch special). For 2 people, 2 apps., 2 miso soups, and 3 sushi orders - came to about $40 w/tax. For apps, had the chicken skewers. It wasn't that bad, but it was bland. I knew to stick to seafood.  The miso was good not too salty. The only roll I can recall the name of is the "Valintine" (sp?)

I'm not certain if it's because they're new, but having a website would be helpful, especially because they deliver. Overall, the place was clean, service was quick, and food was tasty.

The food is always fresh and good quality!  The only complaint I have, is there are "surprise" ingredients in things that I wouldn't expect.   A dish my boyfriend orders all the time suddenly had mushrooms in it.   The Tom Yum had an INSANE amount of bamboo and no other ingredients except for mushrooms and the shrimp (I ordered Shrimp Tom Yum).  BUT the sushi is fantastic and the teppanyaki is very good.
This is our go to place for sushi. Place is always neat and the servers are pleasant. I recommend you to try pink lady sushi. So delish!
Great little place. Sushi is fresh and delicious. Love the Hibachi room. Fun atmosphere for the family. Well priced for a Japanese restaurant.

Ate here for the first time and i gotta say the hibachi is definitely well worth the price. the only thing that is lacking is the flavor. i  had the filet mignon and scallops and chicken. Now their scallops and filet mignon were cooked perfectly. Now for a new place its always packed and thats a good thing, but if you were to compare to Geisha House i would pick Geisha House for food quality and Ohjah for the price. We also tried this albacore and fried onion sushi roll which was delicious. But the hibachi was lacking good sauces and their cooks were not that entertaining and the fried rice was ok.i will come back just dont know when i will say OHJAH is what im craving today.

Came in last minute and they accommodated us at a hibachi table. Food was good. Service and chef were great. A little can be said about the cleanliness.  Under the table was dirty but despite that we enjoyed our time. We will probably come back

My husband and I have been here at least 6 times in the last five months. We have never disliked anything we have ordered. The waitresses are always very sweet and accommodating. We tend to sit in the main part of the restaurant for sushi and chicken teriyaki (basic, I know) and it is always soooo good! We did try the hibachi side once when company was in town and it was tasty. We always take advantage of whatever YELP deal they have going, especially the free Sake

Pretty good food. Portions were a decent size. My only wish is that the dinner plates came with a small side of tempura to have a balanced meal (rice and chicken otherwise- salad and soup as a starter. 

The only odd thing was happy birthday played twice during dinner with no indication of it being someone's birthday. Is that a quirk?
My husband and I went for dinner for the first time there and it was incredible.  The food the atmosphere everything was just all around delicious.  We will definitely be going back.

Always a favorite! Was a little bummed when we ran about 15 mins past our reservation and they could no longer seat us at a Hibachi Table. So we sat at a booth on the restaurant side. As we were about to place our order, a guy, maybe the manager, came over and said there was an opening for our party at a Hibachi table. We were so happy, and immediately got up and moved! The service was very good, quick and polite. They turned those tables around so quickly. The chief was very entertaining. And the food is always really good, and made to order right in front of you. Always a fun time!! Will be back for sure! Highly recommend this location!!
Always busy on a Friday night. Staff is great and attentive. Food is really healthy and fresh will go back again.

I've ordered sushi to go here 3 times already when I'm not in the mood to eat sushi out and it has not disappointed me yet! Their 3 special rolls for $25 deal is such a great option. That literally feeds my boyfriend and I and we normally end up ordering a miso soup, fried rice and noodles or shrimp tempura. This time we got the pot stickers instead of noodles/shrimp tempura and we also ordered these salmon tostada things that I think were called nachos? Those were pretty good too. I haven't tried their hibachi yet but I'm sure I will someday.

This is a very good hibachi place and the prices are cheap! Just for chicken it is $13.25 and for shrimp it is $13.95. Service is nice and even the sushi is good.

PROS: Food, Price, Service
CONS: Gets packed on weekends (long waits)

I went there to celebrate my friend's couple who will marry soon this time:)
We sit at hibachi this time and order some signature rolls (ocean view, rock and roll)
It was first time to try ocean view roll! It was very good! Fresh scallop and asparagus was fantastic combination! Must try!!
Their ginger dressing for house salad is always good :) hibachi combination is very good price!
The food here is awesome, our favorite chef is parisceth, he is funny and the food is always phenomenal. We are weekly customers!

I give this place one star because of the food. We ordered the deluxe sashimi, The fish was not fresh n not cold. ordered beers, beers were almost at warm at my sake (seriously). Told the waitress,she changed it for us. Rt when we finish our sake, my bf said why do I have tea in my cup? the waitress was rt there when he pour the sake n a piece of brown cucumber fell out of the sake bottle, she took that bottle n ran off so fast. It was so gross I threw up! The service was great, definitely not coming back to this place.

Visited this place, which I recently noticed off of Blue Diamond Rd, and I was sure glad I did. Although I was not very hungry when I visited, the service was very friendly and food was fresh. I came here with my fellow yelper Al, and our gyoza, california roll and chicken katsu was worth returning for. 

Their menu includes other dishes besides sushi, and they also offer a hibachi grill side of the restaurant which looks very nice....and very affordable. I will certainly visit them again.

**Summary**
       - Ambiance - A little noisy, but the decor was nice. It was romantically lit with big screens over the sushi bar. A little something for both genders.
       - Owners - First Japanese restaurant that I've been to that had Chinese music playing. You usually see them owned by Japanese or Korean in Vegas. 
       - Soup - They said the soup was onion soup, but I'm pretty sure it was winter melon. It's a pretty traditional Chinese soup. They said they also had miso.
**Ordered**
       - $12.50 Unagi Don - A decent sized piece of eel as far as eels go. A tad dry, but not bad. It comes with soup and salad. Good for those who don't want a big meal.
       - $14.95 New York Steak Teriyaki - A fairly large steak cooked to your liking covered in teriyaki sauce. It also came with a crab rangoon, salad, and a soup. Definitely worth trying if you like steak teriyaki (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sYfHxCqHpIX2HnDhw0JRAA?select=KW4CtKWK4DPBM0uOuXgjFQ).
**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place if you live near Blue Diamond. It's a nice place to eat without having to drive too far.

What can I say..., I was excepting something great..
Everything but great. A total disaster from start to finish. Maybe I should try again.

we tried this place out and loved it!  The hibrachi chef was really good and funny!  The staff was great with our kids.  The food was great especially the sushi!  The portions we good sized and there was enough to take home! Definetly will be eating here again!

We couldn't even eat here.... I mean really!! The guy at the front said that since we didn't make reservations we couldn't eat there. Maybe we didn't understand his broken English..... He said "to eat you need reservation"..... I didn't know I was going to be off work tonight.... It was a spur of the moment date night with the husband.... And we were refused service!!!! I won't be going back!!

Ohjah is the type of place you feel compelled to open a Yelp account for just to tell people how much you love it. 

By far the best hibachi in town. The prices are right, the service and cooks are awesome - genuinely nice people there. 

On a couple occasions if we found ourselves waiting for a bit for a few other people to join our cooking area, they've offered a free appetizer or a free drink. Not sure if that is official policy but it definitely was nice. 

The food is amazing. My girlfriend regularly gets the Salmon. I get Lobster and Filet.

Only have had a couple of the sushi rolls, mainly go there for hibachi, but they were great!

Always a fun atmosphere, always someone's birthday. 

If they could fix ANYTHING it would be to get a better birthday song for their iPod. Man. It's bad. And you'll hear it 1-5 times during your visit. 

Beyond that, excellent place. Absolutely try it.

This was the best meal I've had in a while and we eat out a lot!! The food was amazing!! The service was great! All around we were greatly entertained!!

First of we opted for the Hibachi and I am so glad we did! My fiancé loves sashimi so he ordered the blue fin tuna, I do not really care for the raw stuff only in Miami and LA did I actually enjoy it!! Well I am addicted, that blue fin tuna was so so yummy. He ended up ordering another. For six dollars you get two healthy servings and it melted in my mouth with deliciousness! I am sold that is something  that  I will order again and again!
My fiancé got the trio Hibachi he chose the filet, the scallops and sole!! I ordered the lobster tail. The star for both of us was the sole! It was all delicious but we are still dreaming about that sole!! The filet was yummy and so were the scallops and the lobster but that sole was so memorable and unexpected because I love lobster but the sole was so freaking amazing! By the way my fiancé thought the lobster was awesome, too!
I was not in the mood for sake bombs but my girlfriend that was with us never had one so we decided to get some beer and sake to have sake bombs but the Hibachi chef told us they offer  sake bomb individually which is perfect! Well after the first round we got about 4 more rounds! It was so entertaining the way they do it! We had a blast! The noodles, the soup, the rice, the veggies all so delicious and tasty I had to control myself. Jack was our Hibachi chef and was awesome!! They made us feel so welcomed. My fiancé can chug like no other so they kept giving bigger glasses of beer to try to beat him in the sake bomb challenge, they failed!! Super super night definitely be back again and again! I have already recommended this place to so many! I am so glad to have this place so close to my home Southern Highlands. We like to stay close and anything like that is xtreme sushi! We never feel comfortable and welcomed there and they have some good but a lot mediocre. So this will be our regular spot hope they stay because they are so great and in this economy where people are usually staying home it helps if you treat people right, plus I'd be heart broken if the service was bad because the food was so outstanding!! The whole combo works hope they keep it up and last!

Happily surprised! Clean, and nice set up! We did not eat on hibachi side, rather ordered off the menu. We had for appetizer the lasagna and Cali rolls, tempura dinner, chicken teriyaki dinner. Dinners came with miso soup and salad. Food was nice serving and try even had brown rice at not extra charge (nice)!   We will def come back! I got a gift card after for my parents....

Wanna go to a dinner & a show!? Go to Ohjah! It's a fun and exciting place to go for dinner with family and friends to just celebrate life or their birthdays. 

They start off with a Onion soup and a salad with a thousand island dressing. We decided to SAKE BOMBS- House Sake with Sopporo beer, since we've seen every table do it and it looked fun! 
Then they started the show! The chefs are super interactive and animated. I've eaten the chicken, salmon & scallops teppanyaki! Then towards the end they make you catch the shrimp!

I honestly have a great time every time I go here! Thanks Ohjah for being an awesome place to make memories!

I've been multiple times since they opened and will probably keep coming back. The people who work here are really friendly and that's always a positive!
Their menu is really large so you're bound to find something you like.  I, myself like their sushi combos because you can choose 2-4 rolls from the menu (a deal on it's own), plus you get some pieces of nigiri sushi and some selected sashimi.  The price is decent also!  However if you do order one of these sushi combo platters and also plan to eat regular food off the menu (that's lots of food by the way), you should probably put in your sushi order first because they do tend to take a little longer to make these combos for some reason.
I never tried the hibachi, but there's always lots of people in there so I assume it's pretty good.  

All-in-all, this is a good neighborhood family restaurant and it's worth a try.

Christmas Eve dinner. Yippee.Food was just OK. No return. Had Tempura. It was cold and greasy. Dip was gross. Husband had chicken and beefskewers of some sort. He eats anything and wasn't happy. Service weird and no one in regular restaurant. Teppanyaki was busy. This is our punishment for going somewhere weird on Christmas.
All their sushi are so fresh. Great food and fun in entertainment while you are eating. My favorite was the super white tuna.  Just melts in your mouth. Can't wait to go back for more.

Order the sushi boat! its amazing! really filled us up! the hostess was really great as well, she kept checking up on us and was really nice. 

we first had a small table, and when a slightly bigger table opened up, they we able to move us to accomodate as we wanted some elbow room which was good :)

im very picky on my sushi places, so this place gives the thumbs up to me!

I will bump this restaurant up to a 3-star rating just for the fact that the owners care enough to read the reviews of their restaurant and ask for feedback regarding any negative comments.  Kudos for truly caring about customer feedback!

Nice show,but I like my food to all come at once.I didn't like that the vegtables came out way before the meat was cooked??I think this type of food should all be cooked at the same time.The meat and vegtables were good,but the portions were small.
  I think with a few upgrades this could be 5 stars.
I've ordered take out and sat in and have always enjoyed myself. Of course I didn't add the extra star because of the wait, sometimes. But that's how good this place is.
The best Japanese and hibachi we've found in the Valley so far. Excellent for take-out, and the sushi is top notch.
Food was fresh, hot, & delicious! First time here & everything was great. I would like to try the hibachi next time!

There are places here that is hard to find awesome customer service and I finally found it here!  I came here for my birthday with my 2 young daughters age 8 and 4.  We did the Hibachi and we all had a great time.  My kids eyes were glued staring at the chef thats how good and fun he was!  They didnt know it was my birthday until the guest on the side of us asked if it was my birthday and then my waiter heard about it and asked me if it was bday?  Next thing you know, the lights dimmed and flickered and a birthday song came on and they also sang Happy Birthday!  The food, the service and the atmosphere is absolutely amazing! This is now my new spot because the number one reason:  The Service was beyond A+!  Thank you Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse and Hibachi!!!  And the food was excellent!!!

Love this place. Best price hibachi around. Excellent quality food. Great service. Very good atmosphere. I could eat here at least once a week. As for their sushi bar. Not bad. I would prefer my sushimi sliced a little thinner but still good quality for Vegas. Much better than Osaka or Hamada.

We came here with a crave for hibachi. We don't crave for hibachi very often but it happened to be one of those day, so we decided to give Ohjah a try. 

We came here on a Sunday 6 pm but hibachi table was all full. Have to wait at least an hour. They do not serve hibachi food if you sit at regular table. So I highly recommend making a reservation or call ahead if you're going for hibachi. 

The service was great, the manager was very friendly and polite explained to us about the wait. Our chef was also fun and engaging. We get to see lots of cool tricks as usual. 

Food was just alright. The crave for hibachi is all about that buttery garlic soy sauce fried rice! But it was kind of tasteless and missing the rich butter and garlic taste. Disappoint.. but the shrimp and filet mignon was good. I recommend adding garlic butter with your steak - Yum! 

Overall experience - not impressed. It's just what you can expect at an average hibachi restaurant. If we're craving for hibachi next time, we'll probably go for Benihana since now it's open in Vegas!
I pass by this restaurant all the time without giving it a second look. I wish I would've found this sooner. The food is great and the service is even better. Definitely coming back.

The most tasty dining I love their food,
Atmosphere,and it's a delightful place to take your friends and family. The quality is great and the prices are reasonable. Everyone is happy to see you and it's a pleasant experience.

We went for hibachi dinner last night and it was great. We had reservations for 5 and were seated as soon as we got there. Waiter was very attentive, immediately taking drink, then food orders. Soup and salad came out quickly. Small wait for the hibachi chef, but not too bad. He was very entertaining and I really enjoyed watching the show. I ordered the pick 3 special, got New York Steak, Shrimp and Salmon. It was all fabulous!!! Husband got Sukiaki Beef and really enjoyed it as well. It's not a cheap dinner, but a great value for all the food you get. We will definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I came out to Las Vegas for fun. I searched for hibachi grill and this was one of the first to pop up. We had to drive a little ways since we were staying at Treasure Island but it was definitely worth it. The sushi was very decently priced and yummy. Our hibachi cook was very good. The filet mignon was so juicy, tender and flavorful. I thoroughly enjoyed this place and highly recommend it. :) Would love to go back again.

This place is typical Japanese Hibachi restaurant. I have dined at Hibachi probably over 100x in my life and this was probably my least favorite time.  The cook had zero interaction and did about 1/10 of the tricks that they normally do. Maybe next time we will go to another place.

I love this place. It is fairly new and serve sushi and hibachi mostly. I have been there for both lunch and dinner (hibachi and regular dining) with my husband. The garlic edamame sets this place apart for me. The food is fresh and tasty. The hibachi chefs are fun and entertaining. The servers are pretty good, but have had just a couple issues. Ordered an appetizer once and it never came. When I mentioned to the waiter to just cancel it because our food was just showing up, the appetizer then came. They ended up comp'ing it because of the mix up and I quickly forgave them. Great, clean atmosphere. Other dishes available for those who do not like sushi as well. I highly recommend it for the cautious and daring alike.

Food was amazing, service was great as well! Loved it the sexy mama roll, and the  Teppan was really good too! I thought the fried rice with some of the best fried rice I've ever had! The salad was okay due to the ginger dressing being different...all in all we will definitely eat there again!
This place never disappoints.  The teppanyaki rice and noodles are soooooo good! I always get steak and shrimp, delicious. :)

Ohjah is amazing! Better than benihanas and much cheaper! $40 for two people, when its nearly 80-100 at benihanas. I love their fried rice so much flavor, I honestly love everything about this place and I recommend it to everyone. 

I go here about 2-4 times a week which is ridiculous!!! STOP CONTEMPLATING JUST GO!

I've been here for lunch and the food was good. Now the Hibatchi grill is something else. That food is amazing. Our cook could've been more flashy but the food was just delicious. The servers were great. Very attentive. Had a couple different kinds of sushi as well. All were great.

I LOVE the food here, especially the buttery fried rice at the hibachi grill.  Everything I've had there is good and service is good.  Though I would like to give them 5 stars, I'm giving only 2 because they were shut down by the health department and featured on channel 13 news Dirty Dining recently.  I'm going to wait until I'm not grossed out anymore before I go back.  But I'm guessing I will be back.

I've been here once, so maybe it's too soon to write a rave review and if our next few trips are as good as this one - they'll probably get bumped to a 5 star review. Picked up dinner here on the way home. Had Chicken and Steak Teriyaki dinners - both were really good, love the soup - nice to get an onion broth rather than miso, salad dressing... what is in this stuff??? I'm in love - like typical habachi ginger/garlic dressing only creamier... also there was one little crab ragoon with the dinner that was super tasty. Steak was tender - chicken good too. Sushi was good, only tried a California roll to test them out - so can't really comment too much on the sushi. Husband had a couple hand rolls he liked. So all in all, pretty satisfied. They do seem to be a little pricy - but I was pleasantly surprised with the meal.

I can just now stomach writing this review, from the food I ate here on 12/25/2015. We have been to Ohjah a handful of times for their hibachi room. It has always been ok... Nothing great, and very greasy. The kids love the hibachi experience though, so we've gone for a couple of special occasions, because it's a bit pricy for what you get.

Christmas night, we finished family get togethers early, and thought it would be nice to grab a bite to eat. The places that were open were packed, so we eventually found ourselves here. We ate in the regular dining room. I ordered the salmon teriyaki. It was horrible. It tasted very fishy, and was so over cooked, that it was actually a challenge to chew.  Needless to say, I didn't eat it all.

Four hours later, I barely made it to the bathroom, and basically stayed there for the next two days. I was SO sick. My friend who is an ICU nurse had to come over and give me Zofran... This is the only thing that kept me out of the hospital, as I literally could not keep anything in me for a little over 48 hours. Merry Christmas to me! UGH.

Do NOT trust the food here. There's no need to pay for overpriced food, that can possibly send you to the hospital.
Great place and great service! Second time my heterosexual life partner and myself came to this location and it was wonderful. Great food and service!

My favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas . 
   Their food is some of the best I have ever had . The staff here is very friendly and helpful. The service is always on point.
    For fun day. Try Habachi grill ! Also sushi is very good quality too.
    I love here and for sure I will come back again and again .
Best Japanese Steakhouse in town! Prices are fair, service is excellent.
My favorite local sushi spot! The steakhouse is excellent and very reasonably priced as well.
Yummy!! Super good food!!
well i must say, there food and service was excellent. its really nice to go to somewhere nearby to eat.  its a place you must try. better than geisha and benihana
My 2nd time eating here and food and service is amazing.  Plus super clean.  Love it

Absolutely disgusting! 

I got the worst food poisoning from their disgusting fucking fish and they charged my credit card twice! Their prices are high for shitty sushi, and the ambience is depressing on top of that.

If you like fishy underhanded staff and fish that will make you vomit, eat here. Otherwise I suggest you don't touch it with a 10 foot pole.

My first time here tonight and I had an excellent time! Everyone working here was extremely friendly, from the host, to our server, to our chef who was really funny! Fantastic food, best teppanyaki I've ever had :) definitely will be back!

I think this could be the best bargain for quality hibachi food there is in Vegas! The staff is friendly and fun loving, the food is outstanding, the portions are great, and it is overall my favorite place for this type of dining!
Not a bad place just not the best.  Lobster roll was okay.  The rice was bland.  The experience was fun but not the most talented chefs.

This place is awesome! Have family and friends visiting from out of town and have never been disappointed. Every time they come into town they want to go back there. The chefs are fun to watch and funny. The food is excellent with lots of flavor.

Nothing impressive. It could have been much better but it wasn't. It was very ordinary. They did not give me a chance to relax and enjoy my drink before ordering. Felt rushed. Nice people and quick service. But too quick

I tried the filet mignonette hibachi.  The beef was very tender and cooked just right.  Clear soup and house salad were standard offerings and tasted good.  The only criticism was the fried rice was a little hard, so it needed some more cooking.  The service was excellent.  Overall, a very good meal.

HUGE UPS for seating me at the hibachi grill, even though I was the only one ready to eat.  I have never understood why so many Japanese steakhouses won't fire up the hibachi for only one person, but Ohjah did for me and I appreciated that.
Good food, good price, good service, decent music and a repeat song of Happy Birthday.

This place is typically a 4.5 star place but I give them 5 stars because it is not easy to make it in the food business, especially not in Vegas where the competition is fierce! My personal favorite there during a Hibachi/Teppanyaki dinner is the Choice of 3: chicken / steak / shrimp trio with fried rice. Their fried rice is definitely one of the best in the world! Overall, great chefs, fun people and a nice vibe. I like it there.

Great affordable hibachi for locals! My boyfriend and I enjoy coming here for dinner! Very friendly chefs and staff!  I usually get the filet and scallops with fried rice- the portions are filling and included with your main dish you also receive- onion soup, house salad and grilled veggies. Fun and delicious dinner choice!
Love coming here always a hit ....service is always very attentive weekend are usually busy and they don't seat you in till your whole party is there so come together

Fantastic hibachi! You have to order the basic first - which comes with onion soup, salad, and your choice of fried rice, steamed rice or noodles. That in itself runs about $8.95. Next you add on your choice of meat, fish, shrimp, scallops or lobster - these prices vary from $4.95 - $49. I ordered the teriyaki steak and it was phenomenal! My friend ordered the New York steak and he thought it was amazing as well. We also ordered saki with our meal, 2 large Saporo's and for dessert mango mochi. It was a ton of food and drinks, and I think we spent about $80 with tip for the chef and waiter. Our chef was funny and entertaining. Great experience and we will definitely be going back! Next time I will try the sushi and review.

The sushi and service are consistently very good.

I always order the rainbow roll when I get sushi - for two reasons: it's my favorite and it allows me to compares restaurants. Their rainbow roll ranks well.

They just need a happy hour, or at least specials on Sake!

We ventured off the Vegas strip for this one. My friends kept asking me "WHERE ARE WE GOING? IT'S SO FAR." In reality - a $30 cab ride split between 4 of us was WELL worth it. 

Delicious food. Our waitress was very attentive. Our chef was hilarious, easygoing, fun, and obviously a great cook.

Definitely try the shrimp tempura roll... one of the best I've had. And for Hibachi I recommend the shrimp, any of the steaks, and the fried rice. I wasn't really a fan of the chicken though... a bit dry for my liking.

Love, love, love this place.
This is our third time here. So far so good. Food is fresh.  well-prepared. quality is very good. price is average for sushi.  Service was excellent.

I can't believe I went to this place as many times as I did before trying out the Hibachi grill. It's AWESOME. The food is great and I love the service. For my husband and I, it's our go-to place for date night!

Loved this place. The ambiance, the food, the staff. Everything was excellent.

We did a fire off of different meals at different times and shared them at the table. Mostly susho rolls, a couple of different appetizers, and dessert. The waitress was very accommodating and our food arrived in great timing.

Everything we had was fabulous. The Japanese tea we had to top off our meal was really impressive in both taste and presentation. Also tried a green tea cheesecake that was phenomenal. 

We will definitely be back. I can't wait to try more items off the menu!
